1	and philip went down to the city of samaria , and proclaimed unto them the christ .
1	and the multitudes gave heed with one accord unto the things that were spoken by philip , when they heard , and saw the signs which he did .
1	and there was much joy in that city .
1	to whom they all gave heed , from the least to the greatest , saying , this man is that power of god which is called great .
1	and they gave heed to him , because that of long time he had amazed them with his sorceries .
1	but when they believed philip preaching good tidings concerning the kingdom of god and the name of jesus christ , they were baptized , both men and women .
1	and simon also himself believed : and being baptized , he continued with philip ; and beholding signs and great miracles wrought , he was amazed .
1	now when the apostles that were at jerusalem heard that samaria had received the word of god , they sent unto them peter and john :
1	who , when they were come down , prayed for them , that they might receive the holy spirit :
1	for as yet it was fallen upon none of them : only they had been baptized into the name of the lord jesus .
1	then laid they their hands on them , and they received the holy spirit .
1	now when simon saw that through the laying on of the apostles ’ hands the holy spirit was given , he offered them money ,
1	saying , give me also this power , that on whomsoever i lay my hands , he may receive the holy spirit .
1	but peter said unto him , thy silver perish with thee , because thou hast thought to obtain the gift of god with money .
1	thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter : for thy heart is not right before god .
1	repent therefore of this thy wickedness , and pray the lord , if perhaps the thought of thy heart shall be forgiven thee .
1	for i see that thou art in the gall of bitterness and in the bond of iniquity .
1	and simon answered and said , pray ye for me to the lord , that none of the things which ye have spoken come upon me .
1	they therefore , when they had testified and spoken the word of the lord , returned to jerusalem , and preached the gospel to many villages of the samaritans .
1	and he was returning and sitting in his chariot , and was reading the prophet isaiah .
1	and the spirit said unto philip , go near , and join thyself to this chariot .
1	and philip ran to him , and heard him reading isaiah the prophet , and said , understandest thou what thou readest ?
1	and he said , how can i , except some one shall guide me ? and he besought philip to come up and sit with him .
1	now the passage of the scripture which he was reading was this ,
1	in his humiliation his judgment was taken away :
1	and the eunuch answered philip , and said , i pray thee , of whom speaketh the prophet this ? of himself , or of some other ?
1	and philip opened his mouth , and beginning from this scripture , preached unto him jesus .
1	and he commanded the chariot to stand still : and they both went down into the water , both philip and the eunuch ; and he baptized him .
1	but philip was found at azotus : and passing through he preached the gospel to all the cities , till he came to caesarea .
1	but saul , yet breathing threatening and slaughter against the disciples of the lord , went unto the high priest ,
1	and as he journeyed , it came to pass that he drew nigh unto damascus : and suddenly there shone round about him a light out of heaven :
1	and he fell upon the earth , and heard a voice saying unto him , saul , saul , why persecutest thou me ?
1	and he said , who art thou , lord ? and he said , i am jesus whom thou persecutest :
1	but rise , and enter into the city , and it shall be told thee what thou must do .
1	and the men that journeyed with him stood speechless , hearing the voice , but beholding no man .
1	and he was three days without sight , and did neither eat nor drink .
1	and he hath seen a man named ananias coming in , and laying his hands on him , that he might receive his sight .
1	but ananias answered , lord , i have heard from many of this man , how much evil he did to thy saints at jerusalem :
1	and here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call upon thy name .
1	for i will show him how many things he must suffer for my name ’ s sake .
1	and straightway there fell from his eyes as it were scales , and he received his sight ; and he arose and was baptized ;
1	and he took food and was strengthened .
1	and straightway in the synagogues he proclaimed jesus , that he is the son of god .
1	but saul increased the more in strength , and confounded the jews that dwelt at damascus , proving that this is the christ .
1	and when many days were fulfilled , the jews took counsel together to kill him :
1	but their plot became known to saul . and they watched the gates also day and night that they might kill him :
1	but his disciples took him by night , and let him down through the wall , lowering him in a basket .
1	and he was with them going in and going out at jerusalem ,
1	preaching boldly in the name of the lord : and he spake and disputed against the grecian jews ; but they were seeking to kill him .
1	and when the brethren knew it , they brought him down to caesarea , and sent him forth to tarsus .
1	and it came to pass , as peter went throughout all parts , he came down also to the saints that dwelt at lydda .
1	and there he found a certain man named aeneas , who had kept his bed eight years ; for he was palsied .
1	and peter said unto him , aeneas , jesus christ healeth thee : arise , and make thy bed . and straightway he arose .
1	and all that dwelt at lydda and in sharon saw him , and they turned to the lord .
1	and he gave her his hand , and raised her up ; and calling the saints and widows , he presented her alive .
1	and it became known throughout all joppa : and many believed on the lord .
1	and it came to pass , that he abode many days in joppa with one simon a tanner .
1	now there was a certain man in caesarea , cornelius by name , a centurion of the band called the italian band ,
1	a devout man , and one that feared god with all his house , who gave much alms to the people , and prayed to god always .
1	and now send men to joppa , and fetch one simon , who is surnamed peter :
1	he lodgeth with one simon a tanner , whose house is by the sea side .
1	and when the angel that spake unto him was departed , he called two of his household-servants , and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually ;
1	and having rehearsed all things unto them , he sent them to joppa .
1	and he became hungry , and desired to eat : but while they made ready , he fell into a trance ;
1	and he beholdeth the heaven opened , and a certain vessel descending , as it were a great sheet , let down by four corners upon the earth :
1	wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts and creeping things of the earth and birds of the heaven .
1	and there came a voice to him , rise , peter ; kill and eat .
1	but peter said , not so , lord ; for i have never eaten anything that is common and unclean .
1	and a voice came unto him again the second time , what god hath cleansed , make not thou common .
1	and this was done thrice : and straightway the vessel was received up into heaven .
1	and called and asked whether simon , who was surnamed peter , were lodging there .
1	and while peter thought on the vision , the spirit said unto him , behold , three men seek thee .
1	but arise , and get thee down , and go with them , nothing doubting : for i have sent them .
1	and peter went down to the men , and said , behold , i am he whom ye seek : what is the cause wherefore ye are come ?
1	so he called them in and lodged them .
1	and on the morrow they entered into caesarea . and cornelius was waiting for them , having called together his kinsmen and his near friends .
1	and when it came to pass that peter entered , cornelius met him , and fell down at his feet , and worshipped him .
1	but peter raised him up , saying , stand up ; i myself also am a man .
1	and as he talked with him , he went in , and findeth many come together :
1	wherefore also i came without gainsaying , when i was sent for . i ask therefore with what intent ye sent for me .
1	and saith , cornelius , thy prayer is heard , and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of god .
1	and peter opened his mouth , and said ,
1	but in every nation he that feareth him , and worketh righteousness , is acceptable to him .
1	the word which he sent unto the children of israel , preaching good tidings of peace by jesus christ ( he is lord of all ) —
1	that saying ye yourselves know , which was published throughout all judaea , beginning from galilee , after the baptism which john preached ;
1	him god raised up the third day , and gave him to be made manifest ,
1	to him bear all the prophets witness , that through his name every one that believeth on him shall receive remission of sins .
1	while peter yet spake these words , the holy spirit fell on all them that heard the word .
1	for they heard them speak with tongues , and magnify god . then answered peter ,
1	can any man forbid the water , that these should not be baptized , who have received the holy spirit as well as we ?
1	and he commanded them to be baptized in the name of jesus christ . then prayed they him to tarry certain days .
1	now the apostles and the brethren that were in judaea heard that the gentiles also had received the word of god .
1	and when peter was come up to jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,
1	saying , thou wentest in to men uncircumcised , and didst eat with them .
1	but peter began , and expounded the matter unto them in order , saying ,
1	and i heard also a voice saying unto me , rise , peter ; kill and eat .
1	but i said , not so , lord : for nothing common or unclean hath ever entered into my mouth .
1	but a voice answered the second time out of heaven , what god hath cleansed , make not thou common .
1	and this was done thrice : and all were drawn up again into heaven .
1	and behold , forthwith three men stood before the house in which we were , having been sent from caesarea unto me .
1	who shall speak unto thee words , whereby thou shalt be saved , thou and all thy house .
1	and as i began to speak , the holy spirit fell on them , even as on us at the beginning .
1	and i remembered the word of the lord , how he said , john indeed baptized with water ; but ye shall be baptized in the holy spirit .
1	and when they heard these things , they held their peace , and glorified god , saying , then to the gentiles also hath god granted repentance unto life .
1	and the hand of the lord was with them : and a great number that believed turned unto the lord .
1	and the report concerning them came to the ears of the church which was in jerusalem : and they sent forth barnabas as far as antioch :
1	for he was a good man , and full of the holy spirit and of faith : and much people was added unto the lord .
1	and he went forth to tarsus to seek for saul ;
1	now in these days there came down prophets from jerusalem unto antioch .
1	and the disciples , every man according to his ability , determined to send relief unto the brethren that dwelt in judaea :
1	which also they did , sending it to the elders by the hand of barnabas and saul .
1	now about that time herod the king put forth his hands to afflict certain of the church .
1	and he killed james the brother of john with the sword .
1	and when he saw that it pleased the jews , he proceeded to seize peter also . and those were the days of unleavened bread .
1	peter therefore was kept in the prison : but prayer was made earnestly of the church unto god for him .
1	and he went out , and followed ; and he knew not that it was true which was done by the angel , but thought he saw a vision .
1	and when he knocked at the door of the gate , a maid came to answer , named rhoda .
1	and when she knew peter ’ s voice , she opened not the gate for joy , but ran in , and told that peter stood before the gate .
1	and they said unto her , thou art mad . but she confidently affirmed that it was even so . and they said , it is his angel .
1	but peter continued knocking : and when they had opened , they saw him , and were amazed .
1	now as soon as it was day , there was no small stir among the soldiers , what was become of peter .
1	and upon a set day herod arrayed himself in royal apparel , and sat on the throne , and made an oration unto them .
1	and the people shouted , saying , the voice of a god , and not of a man .
1	but the word of god grew and multiplied .
1	and barnabas and saul returned from jerusalem , when they had fulfilled their ministration , taking with them john whose surname was mark .
1	and as they ministered to the lord , and fasted , the holy spirit said , separate me barnabas and saul for the work whereunto i have called them .
1	then , when they had fasted and prayed and laid their hands on them , they sent them away .
1	so they , being sent forth by the holy spirit , went down to seleucia ; and from thence they sailed to cyprus .
1	and when they were at salamis , they proclaimed the word of god in the synagogues of the jews : and they had also john as their attendant .
1	and when they had gone through the whole island unto paphos , they found a certain sorcerer , a false prophet , a jew , whose name was bar-jesus ;
1	but elymas the sorcerer ( for so is his name by interpretation ) withstood them , seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith .
1	but saul , who is also called paul , filled with the holy spirit , fastened his eyes on him ,
1	then the proconsul , when he saw what was done , believed , being astonished at the teaching of the lord .
1	now paul and his company set sail from paphos , and came to perga in pamphylia : and john departed from them and returned to jerusalem .
1	but they , passing through from perga , came to antioch of pisidia ; and they went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and sat down .
1	and paul stood up , and beckoning with the hand said ,
1	and for about the time of forty years as a nursing-father bare he them in the wilderness .
1	and when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of canaan , he gave them their land for an inheritance , for about four hundred and fifty years :
1	and after these things he gave them judges until samuel the prophet .
1	of this man ’ s seed hath god according to promise brought unto israel a saviour , jesus ;
1	when john had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of israel .
1	brethren , children of the stock of abraham , and those among you that fear god , to us is the word of this salvation sent forth .
1	and though they found no cause of death in him , yet asked they of pilate that he should be slain .
1	and when they had fulfilled all things that were written of him , they took him down from the tree , and laid him in a tomb .
1	but god raised him from the dead :
1	and he was seen for many days of them that came up with him from galilee to jerusalem , who are now his witnesses unto the people .
1	and we bring you good tidings of the promise made unto the fathers ,
1	because he saith also in another psalm , thou wilt not give thy holy one to see corruption .
1	for david , after he had in his own generation served the counsel of god , fell asleep , and was laid unto his fathers , and saw corruption :
1	but he whom god raised up saw no corruption .
1	be it known unto you therefore , brethren , that through this man is proclaimed unto you remission of sins :
1	and by him every one that believeth is justified from all things , from which ye could not be justified by the law of moses .
1	beware therefore , lest that come upon you which is spoken in the prophets :
1	behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish ;
1	and as they went out , they besought that these words might be spoken to them the next sabbath .
1	and the next sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of god .
1	but when the jews saw the multitudes , they were filled with jealousy , and contradicted the things which were spoken by paul , and blasphemed .
1	for so hath the lord commanded us , saying ,
1	and as the gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of god : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
1	and the word of the lord was spread abroad throughout all the region .
1	but they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto iconium .
1	and the disciples were filled with joy and with the holy spirit .
1	but the jews that were disobedient stirred up the souls of the gentiles , and made them evil affected against the brethren .
1	but the multitude of the city was divided ; and part held with the jews , and part with the apostles .
1	and when there was made an onset both of the gentiles and of the jews with their rulers , to treat them shamefully and to stone them ,
1	they became aware of it , and fled unto the cities of lycaonia , lystra and derbe , and the region round about :
1	and there they preached the gospel .
1	and at lystra there sat a certain man , impotent in his feet , a cripple from his mother ’ s womb , who never had walked .
1	the same heard paul speaking : who , fastening his eyes upon him , and seeing that he had faith to be made whole ,
1	said with a loud voice , stand upright on thy feet . and he leaped up and walked .
1	and they called barnabas , jupiter ; and paul , mercury , because he was the chief speaker .
1	and the priest of jupiter whose temple was before the city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the multitudes .
1	but when the apostles , barnabas and paul , heard of it , they rent their garments , and sprang forth among the multitude , crying out
1	who in the generations gone by suffered all the nations to walk in their own ways .
1	and with these sayings scarce restrained they the multitudes from doing sacrifice unto them .
1	and when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had made many disciples , they returned to lystra , and to iconium , and to antioch ,
1	confirming the souls of the disciples , exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that through many tribulations we must enter into the kingdom of god .
1	and they passed through pisidia , and came to pamphylia .
1	and when they had spoken the word in perga , they went down to attalia ;
1	and thence they sailed to antioch , from whence they had been committed to the grace of god for the work which they had fulfilled .
1	and they tarried no little time with the disciples .
1	and certain men came down from judaea and taught the brethren , saying , except ye be circumcised after the custom of moses , ye can not be saved .
1	and the apostles and the elders were gathered together to consider of this matter .
1	and when there had been much questioning , peter rose up , and said unto them ,
1	and god , who knoweth the heart , bare them witness , giving them the holy spirit , even as he did unto us ;
1	and he made no distinction between us and them , cleansing their hearts by faith .
1	but we believe that we shall be saved through the grace of the lord jesus , in like manner as they .
1	and all the multitude kept silence ; and they hearkened unto barnabas and paul rehearsing what signs and wonders god had wrought among the gentiles through them .
1	and after they had held their peace , james answered , saying ,
1	symeon hath rehearsed how first god visited the gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
1	and to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
1	after these things i will return ,
1	that the residue of men may seek after the lord ,
1	saith the lord , who maketh these things known from of old .
1	wherefore my judgment is , that we trouble not them that from among the gentiles turn to god ;
1	but that we write unto them , that they abstain from the pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from what is strangled , and from blood .
1	for moses from generations of old hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath .
1	forasmuch as we have heard that certain who went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls ; to whom we gave no commandment ;
1	it seemed good unto us , having come to one accord , to choose out men and send them unto you with our beloved barnabas and paul ,
1	men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our lord jesus christ .
1	we have sent therefore judas and silas , who themselves also shall tell you the same things by word of mouth .
1	for it seemed good to the holy spirit , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things :
1	so they , when they were dismissed , came down to antioch ; and having gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle .
1	and when they had read it , they rejoiced for the consolation .
1	and judas and silas , being themselves also prophets , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
1	and after they had spent some time there , they were dismissed in peace from the brethren unto those that had sent them forth .
1	but paul and barnabas tarried in antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the lord , with many others also .
1	and barnabas was minded to take with them john also , who was called mark .
1	but paul thought not good to take with them him who withdrew from them from pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
1	and there arose a sharp contention , so that they parted asunder one from the other , and barnabas took mark with him , and sailed away unto cyprus :
1	but paul chose silas , and went forth , being commended by the brethren to the grace of the lord .
1	and he went through syria and cilicia , confirming the churches .
1	the same was well reported of by the brethren that were at lystra and iconium .
1	so the churches were strengthened in the faith , and increased in number daily .
1	and they went through the region of phrygia and galatia , having been forbidden of the holy spirit to speak the word in asia ;
1	and when they were come over against mysia , they assayed to go into bithynia ; and the spirit of jesus suffered them not ;
1	and passing by mysia , they came down to troas .
1	and when he had seen the vision , straightway we sought to go forth into macedonia , concluding that god had called us to preach the gospel unto them .
1	setting sail therefore from troas , we made a straight course to samothrace , and the day following to neapolis ;
1	and when they had brought them unto the magistrates , they said , these men , being jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
1	and set forth customs which it is not lawful for us to receive , or to observe , being romans .
1	and the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent their garments off them , and commanded to beat them with rods .
1	and when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
1	who , having received such a charge , cast them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
1	but about midnight paul and silas were praying and singing hymns unto god , and the prisoners were listening to them ;
1	but paul cried with a loud voice , saying , do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
1	and he called for lights and sprang in , and , trembling for fear , fell down before paul and silas ,
1	and brought them out and said , sirs , what must i do to be saved ?
1	and they said , believe on the lord jesus , and thou shalt be saved , thou and thy house .
1	and they spake the word of the lord unto him , with all that were in his house .
1	and he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , immediately .
1	and he brought them up into his house , and set food before them , and rejoiced greatly , with all his house , having believed in god .
1	but when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , let those men go .
1	and the jailor reported the words to paul , saying , the magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore come forth , and go in peace .
1	and the serjeants reported these words unto the magistrates : and they feared when they heard that they were romans ;
1	and they came and besought them ; and when they had brought them out , they asked them to go away from the city .
1	now when they had passed through amphipolis and apollonia , they came to thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the jews :
1	and paul , as his custom was , went in unto them , and for three sabbath days reasoned with them from the scriptures ,
1	whom jason hath received : and these all act contrary to the decrees of caesar , saying that there is another king , one jesus .
1	and they troubled the multitude and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
1	and when they had taken security from jason and the rest , they let them go .
1	and the brethren immediately sent away paul and silas by night unto beroea : who when they were come thither went into the synagogue of the jews .
1	many of them therefore believed ; also of the greek women of honorable estate , and of men , not a few .
1	and then immediately the brethren sent forth paul to go as far as to the sea : and silas and timothy abode there still .
1	now while paul waited for them at athens , his spirit was provoked within him as he beheld the city full of idols .
1	so he reasoned in the synagogue with the jews and the devout persons , and in the marketplace every day with them that met him .
1	for thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
1	( now all the athenians and the strangers sojourning there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell or to hear some new thing . )
1	and paul stood in the midst of the areopagus , and said ,
1	the god that made the world and all things therein , he , being lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
1	that they should seek god , if haply they might feel after him and find him , though he is not far from each one of us :
1	for in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain even of your own poets have said ,
1	the times of ignorance therefore god overlooked ; but now he commandeth men that they should all everywhere repent :
1	now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked ; but others said , we will hear thee concerning this yet again .
1	thus paul went out from among them .
1	but certain men clave unto him , and believed : among whom also was dionysius the areopagite , and a woman named damaris , and others with them .
1	after these things he departed from athens , and came to corinth .
1	and because he was of the same trade , he abode with them , and they wrought ; for by their trade they were tentmakers .
1	and he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded jews and greeks .
1	but when silas and timothy came down from macedonia , paul was constrained by the word , testifying to the jews that jesus was the christ .
1	and crispus , the ruler of the synagogue , believed in the lord with all his house ; and many of the corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
1	and the lord said unto paul in the night by a vision , be not afraid , but speak and hold not thy peace :
1	for i am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to harm thee : for i have much people in this city .
1	and he dwelt there a year and six months , teaching the word of god among them .
1	but when gallio was proconsul of achaia , the jews with one accord rose up against paul and brought him before the judgment-seat ,
1	saying , this man persuadeth men to worship god contrary to the law .
1	and he drove them from the judgment-seat .
1	and they all laid hold on sosthenes , the ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment-seat . and gallio cared for none of these things .
1	and they came to ephesus , and he left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the jews .
1	and when they asked him to abide a longer time , he consented not ;
1	but taking his leave of them , and saying , i will return again unto you if god will , he set sail from ephesus .
1	and when he had landed at caesarea , he went up and saluted the church , and went down to antioch .
1	and having spent some time there , he departed , and went through the region of galatia , and phrygia , in order , establishing all the disciples .
1	now a certain jew named apollos , an alexandrian by race , an eloquent man , came to ephesus ; and he was mighty in the scriptures .
1	for he powerfully confuted the jews , and that publicly , showing by the scriptures that jesus was the christ .
1	and it came to pass , that , while apollos was at corinth , paul having passed through the upper country came to ephesus , and found certain disciples :
1	and he said , into what then were ye baptized ? and they said , into john ’ s baptism .
1	and when they heard this , they were baptized into the name of the lord jesus .
1	and when paul had laid his hands upon them , the holy spirit came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
1	and they were in all about twelve men .
1	and he entered into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , reasoning and persuading as to the things concerning the kingdom of god .
1	and this continued for the space of two years ; so that all they that dwelt in asia heard the word of the lord , both jews and greeks .
1	and god wrought special miracles by the hands of paul :
1	insomuch that unto the sick were carried away from his body handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out .
1	and there were seven sons of one sceva , a jew , a chief priest , who did this .
1	and the evil spirit answered and said unto them , jesus i know , and paul i know ; but who are ye ?
1	many also of them that had believed came , confessing , and declaring their deeds .
1	so mightily grew the word of the lord and prevailed .
1	and having sent into macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , timothy and erastus , he himself stayed in asia for a while .
1	and about that time there arose no small stir concerning the way .
1	for a certain man named demetrius , a silversmith , who made silver shrines of diana , brought no little business unto the craftsmen ;
1	whom he gathered together , with the workmen of like occupation , and said , sirs , ye know that by this business we have our wealth .
1	and when they heard this they were filled with wrath , and cried out , saying , great is diana of the ephesians .
1	and when paul was minded to enter in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
1	and certain also of the asiarchs , being his friends , sent unto him and besought him not to adventure himself into the theatre .
1	some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was in confusion ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
1	but when they perceived that he was a jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , great is diana of the ephesians .
1	seeing then that these things can not be gainsaid , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rash .
1	for ye have brought hither these men , who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of our goddess .
1	but if ye seek anything about other matters , it shall be settled in the regular assembly .
1	and when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
1	and after the uproar ceased , paul having sent for the disciples and exhorted them , took leave of them , and departed to go into macedonia .
1	and when he had gone through those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into greece .
1	but these had gone before , and were waiting for us at troas .
1	and we sailed away from philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to troas in five days ; where we tarried seven days .
1	and there were many lights in the upper chamber where we were gathered together .
1	and paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , make ye no ado ; for his life is in him .
1	and they brought the lad alive , and were not a little comforted .
1	and when he met us at assos , we took him in , and came to mitylene .
1	and from miletus he sent to ephesus , and called to him the elders of the church .
1	and when they were come to him , he said unto them ,
1	serving the lord with all lowliness of mind , and with tears , and with trials which befell me by the plots of the jews ;
1	how i shrank not from declaring unto you anything that was profitable , and teaching you publicly , and from house to house ,
1	testifying both to jews and to greeks repentance toward god , and faith toward our lord jesus christ .
1	and now , behold , i go bound in the spirit unto jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
1	save that the holy spirit testifieth unto me in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
1	and now , behold , i know that ye all , among whom i went about preaching the kingdom , shall see my face no more .
1	wherefore i testify unto you this day , that i am pure from the blood of all men .
1	for i shrank not from declaring unto you the whole counsel of god .
1	i know that after my departing grievous wolves shall enter in among you , not sparing the flock ;
1	and from among your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away the disciples after them .
1	wherefore watch ye , remembering that by the space of three years i ceased not to admonish every one night and day with tears .
1	i coveted no man ’ s silver , or gold , or apparel .
1	ye yourselves know that these hands ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
1	and when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down and prayed with them all .
1	and they all wept sore , and fell on paul ’ s neck and kissed him ,
1	and having found a ship crossing over unto phoenicia , we went aboard , and set sail .
1	and having found the disciples , we tarried there seven days : and these said to paul through the spirit , that he should not set foot in jerusalem .
1	and we went on board the ship , but they returned home again .
1	and when we had finished the voyage from tyre , we arrived at ptolemais ; and we saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
1	now this man had four virgin daughters , who prophesied .
1	and as we tarried there some days , there came down from judaea a certain prophet , named agabus .
1	and when we heard these things , both we and they of that place besought him not to go up to jerusalem .
1	and when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , the will of the lord be done .
1	and after these days we took up our baggage and went up to jerusalem .
1	and when we were come to jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
1	and the day following paul went in with us unto james ; and all the elders were present .
1	and when he had saluted them , he rehearsed one by one the things which god had wrought among the gentiles through his ministry .
1	what is it therefore ? they will certainly hear that thou art come .
1	do therefore this that we say to thee : we have four men that have a vow on them ;
1	for they had before seen with him in the city trophimus the ephesian , whom they supposed that paul had brought into the temple .
1	and as they were seeking to kill him , tidings came up to the chief captain of the band , that all jerusalem was in confusion .
1	and when he came upon the stairs , so it was that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the crowd ;
1	for the multitude of the people followed after , crying out , away with him .
1	art thou not then the egyptian , who before these days stirred up to sedition and led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the assassins ?
1	brethren and fathers , hear ye the defence which i now make unto you .
1	and when they heard that he spake unto them in the hebrew language , they were the more quiet : and he saith ,
1	and i persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
1	and i fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , saul , saul , why persecutest thou me ?
1	and i answered , who art thou , lord ? and he said unto me , i am jesus of nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
1	and they that were with me beheld indeed the light , but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
1	and when i could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me i came into damascus .
1	and one ananias , a devout man according to the law , well reported of by all the jews that dwelt there ,
1	came unto me , and standing by me said unto me , brother saul , receive thy sight . and in that very hour i looked up on him .
1	for thou shalt be a witness for him unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
1	and now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on his name .
1	and it came to pass , that , when i had returned to jerusalem , and while i prayed in the temple , i fell into a trance ,
1	and saw him saying unto me , make haste , and get thee quickly out of jerusalem ; because they will not receive of thee testimony concerning me .
1	and i said , lord , they themselves know that i imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
1	and when the blood of stephen thy witness was shed , i also was standing by , and consenting , and keeping the garments of them that slew him .
1	and he said unto me , depart : for i will send thee forth far hence unto the gentiles .
1	and as they cried out , and threw off their garments , and cast dust into the air ,
1	and the chief captain came and said unto him , tell me , art thou a roman ? and he said , yea .
1	and the chief captain answered , with a great sum obtained i this citizenship . and paul said , but i am a roman born .
1	and paul , looking stedfastly on the council , said , brethren , i have lived before god in all good conscience until this day .
1	and the high priest ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
1	and they that stood by said , revilest thou god ’ s high priest ?
1	and when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the pharisees and sadducees ; and the assembly was divided .
1	for the sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit ; but the pharisees confess both .
1	and they were more than forty that made this conspiracy .
1	but paul ’ s sister ’ s son heard of their lying in wait , and he came and entered into the castle and told paul .
1	and paul called unto him one of the centurions , and said , bring this young man unto the chief captain ; for he hath something to tell him .
1	and the chief captain took him by the hand , and going aside asked him privately , what is it that thou hast to tell me ?
1	so the chief captain let the young man go , charging him , tell no man that thou hast signified these things to me .
1	and he bade them provide beasts , that they might set paul thereon , and bring him safe unto felix the governor .
1	and he wrote a letter after this form :
1	claudius lysias unto the most excellent governor felix , greeting .
1	and desiring to know the cause wherefore they accused him , i brought him down unto their council :
1	whom i found to be accused about questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
1	so the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took paul and brought him by night to antipatris .
1	but on the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
1	and they , when they came to caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , presented paul also before him .
1	and when he had read it , he asked of what province he was ; and when he understood that he was of cilicia ,
1	i will hear thee fully , said he , when thine accusers also are come : and he commanded him to be kept in herod ’ s palace .
1	and after five days the high priest ananias came down with certain elders , and with an orator , one tertullus ; and they informed the governor against paul .
1	and when he was called , tertullus began to accuse him , saying ,
1	we accept it in all ways and in all places , most excellent felix , with all thankfulness .
1	but , that i be not further tedious unto thee , i entreat thee to hear us of thy clemency a few words .
1	who moreover assayed to profane the temple : on whom also we laid hold :
1	from whom thou wilt be able , by examining him thyself , to take knowledge of all these things whereof we accuse him .
1	and the jews also joined in the charge , affirming that these things were so .
1	and when the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , paul answered ,
1	seeing that thou canst take knowledge that it is not more than twelve days since i went up to worship at jerusalem :
1	and neither in the temple did they find me disputing with any man or stirring up a crowd , nor in the synagogues , nor in the city .
1	neither can they prove to thee the things whereof they now accuse me .
1	having hope toward god , which these also themselves look for , that there shall be a resurrection both of the just and unjust .
1	herein i also exercise myself to have a conscience void of offence toward god and men always .
1	now after some years i came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings :
1	amidst which they found me purified in the temple , with no crowd , nor yet with tumult : but there were certain jews from asia—
1	who ought to have been here before thee , and to make accusation , if they had aught against me .
1	or else let these men themselves say what wrong-doing they found when i stood before the council ,
1	he hoped withal that money would be given him of paul : wherefore also he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
1	but when two years were fulfilled , felix was succeeded by porcius festus ; and desiring to gain favor with the jews , felix left paul in bonds .
1	festus therefore , having come into the province , after three days went up to jerusalem from caesarea .
1	and the chief priests and the principal men of the jews informed him against paul ; and they besought him ,
1	asking a favor against him , that he would send for him to jerusalem ; laying a plot to kill him on the way .
1	howbeit festus answered , that paul was kept in charge at caesarea , and that he himself was about to depart thither shortly .
1	while paul said in his defence , neither against the law of the jews , nor against the temple , nor against caesar , have i sinned at all .
1	then festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , thou hast appealed unto caesar : unto caesar shalt thou go .
1	now when certain days were passed , agrippa the king and bernice arrived at caesarea , and saluted festus .
1	about whom , when i was at jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the jews informed me , asking for sentence against him .
1	concerning whom , when the accusers stood up , they brought no charge of such evil things as i supposed ;
1	but had certain questions against him of their own religion , and of one jesus , who was dead , whom paul affirmed to be alive .
1	and i , being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things , asked whether he would go to jerusalem and there be judged of these matters .
1	but when paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor , i commanded him to be kept till i should send him to caesar .
1	and agrippa said unto festus , i also could wish to hear the man myself . to-morrow , saith he , thou shalt hear him .
1	but i found that he had committed nothing worthy of death : and as he himself appealed to the emperor i determined to send him .
1	for it seemeth to me unreasonable , in sending a prisoner , not withal to signify the charges against him .
1	and agrippa said unto paul , thou art permitted to speak for thyself . then paul stretched forth his hand , and made his defence :
1	especially because thou art expert in all customs and questions which are among the jews : wherefore i beseech thee to hear me patiently .
1	my manner of life then from my youth up , which was from the beginning among mine own nation and at jerusalem , know all the jews ;
1	having knowledge of me from the first , if they be willing to testify , that after the straitest sect of our religion i lived a pharisee .
1	and now i stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made of god unto our fathers ;
1	why is it judged incredible with you , if god doth raise the dead ?
1	i verily thought with myself that i ought to do many things contrary to the name of jesus of nazareth .
1	whereupon as i journeyed to damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests ,
1	and i said , who art thou , lord ? and the lord said , i am jesus whom thou persecutest .
1	delivering thee from the people , and from the gentiles , unto whom i send thee ,
1	wherefore , o king agrippa , i was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
1	for this cause the jews seized me in the temple , and assayed to kill me .
1	how that the christ must suffer , and how that he first by the resurrection of the dead should proclaim light both to the people and to the gentiles .
1	and as he thus made his defence , festus saith with a loud voice , paul , thou art mad ; thy much learning is turning thee mad .
1	but paul saith , i am not mad , most excellent festus ; but speak forth words of truth and soberness .
1	king agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? i know that thou believest .
1	and agrippa said unto paul , with but little persuasion thou wouldest fain make me a christian .
1	and the king rose up , and the governor , and bernice , and they that sat with them :
1	and when they had withdrawn , they spake one to another , saying , this man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
1	and agrippa said unto festus , this man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto caesar .
1	and when it was determined that we should sail for italy , they delivered paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named julius , of the augustan band .
1	and the next day we touched at sidon : and julius treated paul kindly , and gave him leave to go unto his friends and refresh himself .
1	and putting to sea from thence , we sailed under the lee of cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
1	and when we had sailed across the sea which is off cilicia and pamphylia , we came to myra , a city of lycia .
1	and there the centurion found a ship of alexandria sailing for italy ; and he put us therein .
1	and with difficulty coasting along it we came unto a certain place called fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of lasea .
1	and when much time was spent , and the voyage was now dangerous , because the fast was now already gone by , paul admonished them ,
1	but the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship , than to those things which were spoken by paul .
1	and when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , they weighed anchor and sailed along crete , close in shore .
1	but after no long time there beat down from it a tempestuous wind , which is called euraquilo :
1	and when the ship was caught , and could not face the wind , we gave way to it , and were driven .
1	and running under the lee of a small island called cauda , we were able , with difficulty , to secure the boat :
1	and as we labored exceedingly with the storm , the next day they began to throw the freight overboard ;
1	and the third day they cast out with their own hands the tackling of the ship .
1	and now i exhort you to be of good cheer ; for there shall be no loss of life among you , but only of the ship .
1	for there stood by me this night an angel of the god whose i am , whom also i serve ,
1	saying , fear not , paul ; thou must stand before caesar : and lo , god hath granted thee all them that sail with thee .
1	wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for i believe god , that it shall be even so as it hath been spoken unto me .
1	but we must be cast upon a certain island .
1	and they sounded , and found twenty fathoms ; and after a little space , they sounded again , and found fifteen fathoms .
1	and fearing lest haply we should be cast ashore on rocky ground , they let go four anchors from the stern , and wished for the day .
1	paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , except these abide in the ship , ye can not be saved .
1	then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
1	then were they all of good cheer , and themselves also took food .
1	and we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
1	and when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , throwing out the wheat into the sea .
1	and the soldiers ’ counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
1	and when we were escaped , then we knew that the island was called melita .
1	howbeit he shook off the creature into the fire , and took no harm .
1	and when this was done , the rest also that had diseases in the island came , and were cured :
1	who also honored us with many honors ; and when we sailed , they put on board such things as we needed .
1	and after three months we set sail in a ship of alexandria which had wintered in the island , whose sign was the twin brothers .
1	and touching at syracuse , we tarried there three days .
1	where we found brethren , and were entreated to tarry with them seven days : and so we came to rome .
1	and when we entered into rome , paul was suffered to abide by himself with the soldier that guarded him .
1	who , when they had examined me , desired to set me at liberty , because there was no cause of death in me .
1	but when the jews spake against it , i was constrained to appeal unto caesar ; not that i had aught whereof to accuse my nation .
1	for this cause therefore did i entreat you to see and to speak with me : for because of the hope of israel i am bound with this chain .
1	but we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , it is known to us that everywhere it is spoken against .
1	and some believed the things which were spoken , and some disbelieved .
1	for this people ’ s heart is waxed gross ,
1	be it known therefore unto you , that this salvation of god is sent unto the gentiles : they will also hear .
1	and he abode two whole years in his own hired dwelling , and received all that went in unto him ,
1	preaching the kingdom of god , and teaching the things concerning the lord jesus christ with all boldness , none forbidding him .
1	but i will send a fire into the house of hazael , and it shall devour the palaces of ben-hadad .
1	but i will send a fire on the wall of gaza , and it shall devour the palaces thereof .
1	but i will send a fire on the wall of tyre , and it shall devour the palaces thereof .
1	but i will send a fire upon teman , and it shall devour the palaces of bozrah .
1	and their king shall go into captivity , he and his princes together , saith jehovah .
1	and i will cut off the judge from the midst thereof , and will slay all the princes thereof with him , saith jehovah .
1	but i will send a fire upon judah , and it shall devour the palaces of jerusalem .
1	also i brought you up out of the land of egypt , and led you forty years in the wilderness , to possess the land of the amorite .
1	but ye gave the nazirites wine to drink , and commanded the prophets , saying , prophesy not .
1	behold , i will press you in your place , as a cart presseth that is full of sheaves .
1	and flight shall perish from the swift ; and the strong shall not strengthen his force ; neither shall the mighty deliver himself ;
1	and he that is courageous among the mighty shall flee away naked in that day , saith jehovah .
1	you only have i known of all the families of the earth : therefore i will visit upon you all your iniquities .
1	shall two walk together , except they have agreed ?
1	will a lion roar in the forest , when he hath no prey ? will a young lion cry out of his den , if he have taken nothing ?
1	shall the trumpet be blown in a city , and the people not be afraid ? shall evil befall a city , and jehovah hath not done it ?
1	surely the lord jehovah will do nothing , except he reveal his secret unto his servants the prophets .
1	the lion hath roared ; who will not fear ? the lord jehovah hath spoken ; who can but prophesy ?
1	for they know not to do right , saith jehovah , who store up violence and robbery in their palaces .
1	hear ye , and testify against the house of jacob , saith the lord jehovah , the god of hosts .
1	and i will smite the winter-house with the summer-house ; and the houses of ivory shall perish , and the great houses shall have an end , saith jehovah .
1	and ye shall go out at the breaches , every one straight before her ; and ye shall cast yourselves into harmon , saith jehovah .
1	come to beth-el , and transgress ; to gilgal , and multiply transgression ; and bring your sacrifices every morning , and your tithes every three days ;
1	so two or three cities wandered unto one city to drink water , and were not satisfied : yet have ye not returned unto me , saith jehovah .
1	therefore thus will i do unto thee , o israel ; and because i will do this unto thee , prepare to meet thy god , o israel .
1	hear ye this word which i take up for a lamentation over you , o house of israel .
1	the virgin of israel is fallen ; she shall no more rise : she is cast down upon her land ; there is none to raise her up .
1	for thus saith jehovah unto the house of israel , seek ye me , and ye shall live ;
1	ye who turn justice to wormwood , and cast down righteousness to the earth ,
1	that bringeth sudden destruction upon the strong , so that destruction cometh upon the fortress .
1	they hate him that reproveth in the gate , and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly .
1	therefore he that is prudent shall keep silence in such a time ; for it is an evil time .
1	seek good , and not evil , that ye may live ; and so jehovah , the god of hosts , will be with you , as ye say .
1	and in all vineyards shall be wailing ; for i will pass through the midst of thee , saith jehovah .
1	woe unto you that desire the day of jehovah ! wherefore would ye have the day of jehovah ? it is darkness , and not light .
1	shall not the day of jehovah be darkness , and not light ? even very dark , and no brightness in it ?
1	i hate , i despise your feasts , and i will take no delight in your solemn assemblies .
1	yea , though ye offer me your burnt-offerings and meal-offerings , i will not accept them ; neither will i regard the peace-offerings of your fat beasts .
1	take thou away from me the noise of thy songs ; for i will not hear the melody of thy viols .
1	but let justice roll down as waters , and righteousness as a mighty stream .
1	did ye bring unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years , o house of israel ?
1	yea , ye have borne the tabernacle of your king and the shrine of your images , the star of your god , which ye made to yourselves .
1	therefore will i cause you to go into captivity beyond damascus , saith jehovah , whose name is the god of hosts .
1	—ye that put far away the evil day , and cause the seat of violence to come near ;
1	that sing idle songs to the sound of the viol ; that invent for themselves instruments of music , like david ;
1	that drink wine in bowls , and anoint themselves with the chief oils ; but they are not grieved for the affliction of joseph .
1	therefore shall they now go captive with the first that go captive ; and the revelry of them that stretched themselves shall pass away .
1	and it shall come to pass , if there remain ten men in one house , that they shall die .
1	for , behold , jehovah commandeth , and the great house shall be smitten with breaches , and the little house with clefts .
1	shall horses run upon the rock ? will one plow there with oxen ? that ye have turned justice into gall , and the fruit of righteousness into wormwood ;
1	ye that rejoice in a thing of nought , that say , have we not taken to us horns by our own strength ?
1	jehovah repented concerning this : it shall not be , saith jehovah .
1	then said i , o lord jehovah , cease , i beseech thee : how shall jacob stand ? for he is small .
1	jehovah repented concerning this : this also shall not be , saith the lord jehovah .
1	thus he showed me : and , behold , the lord stood beside a wall made by a plumb-line , with a plumb-line in his hand .
1	for thus amos saith , jeroboam shall die by the sword , and israel shall surely be led away captive out of his land .
1	also amaziah said unto amos , o thou seer , go , flee thou away into the land of judah , and there eat bread , and prophesy there :
1	but prophesy not again any more at beth-el ; for it is the king ’ s sanctuary , and it is a royal house .
1	and jehovah took me from following the flock , and jehovah said unto me , go , prophesy unto my people israel .
1	now therefore hear thou the word of jehovah : thou sayest , prophesy not against israel , and drop not thy word against the house of isaac ;
1	thus the lord jehovah showed me : and , behold , a basket of summer fruit .
1	hear this , o ye that would swallow up the needy , and cause the poor of the land to fail ,
1	that we may buy the poor for silver , and the needy for a pair of shoes , and sell the refuse of the wheat ?
1	jehovah hath sworn by the excellency of jacob , surely i will never forget any of their works .
1	in that day shall the fair virgins and the young men faint for thirst .
1	though they dig into sheol , thence shall my hand take them ; and though they climb up to heaven , thence will i bring them down .
1	all the sinners of my people shall die by the sword , who say , the evil shall not overtake nor meet us .
1	that they may possess the remnant of edom , and all the nations that are called by my name , saith jehovah that doeth this .
1	paul , an apostle of christ jesus through the will of god , and timothy our brother ,
1	to the saints and faithful brethren in christ that are at colossae : grace to you and peace from god our father .
1	we give thanks to god the father of our lord jesus christ , praying always for you ,
1	having heard of your faith in christ jesus , and of the love which ye have toward all the saints ,
1	because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens , whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel ,
1	even as ye learned of epaphras our beloved fellow-servant , who is a faithful minister of christ on our behalf ,
1	who also declared unto us your love in the spirit .
1	to walk worthily of the lord unto all pleasing , bearing fruit in every good work , and increasing in the knowledge of god ;
1	strengthened with all power , according to the might of his glory , unto all patience and longsuffering with joy ;
1	giving thanks unto the father , who made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light ;
1	who delivered us out of the power of darkness , and translated us into the kingdom of the son of his love ;
1	in whom we have our redemption , the forgiveness of our sins :
1	who is the image of the invisible god , the firstborn of all creation ;
1	and he is before all things , and in him all things consist .
1	for it was the good pleasure of the father that in him should all the fulness dwell ;
1	and you , being in time past alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil works ,
1	yet now hath he reconciled in the body of his flesh through death , to present you holy and without blemish and unreproveable before him :
1	whereof i was made a minister , according to the dispensation of god which was given me to you-ward , to fulfil the word of god ,
1	even the mystery which hath been hid for ages and generations : but now hath it been manifested to his saints ,
1	whom we proclaim , admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom , that we may present every man perfect in christ ;
1	whereunto i labor also , striving according to his working , which worketh in me mightily .
1	in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden .
1	this i say , that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech .
1	as therefore ye received christ jesus the lord , so walk in him ,
1	rooted and builded up in him , and established in your faith , even as ye were taught , abounding in thanksgiving .
1	for in him dwelleth all the fulness of the godhead bodily ,
1	and in him ye are made full , who is the head of all principality and power :
1	having been buried with him in baptism , wherein ye were also raised with him through faith in the working of god , who raised him from the dead .
1	having despoiled the principalities and the powers , he made a show of them openly , triumphing over them in it .
1	let no man therefore judge you in meat , or in drink , or in respect of a feast day or a new moon or a sabbath day :
1	which are a shadow of the things to come ; but the body is christ ’ s .
1	if ye died with christ from the rudiments of the world , why , as though living in the world , do ye subject yourselves to ordinances ,
1	handle not , nor taste , nor touch
1	( all which things are to perish with the using ) , after the precepts and doctrines of men ?
1	if then ye were raised together with christ , seek the things that are above , where christ is , seated on the right hand of god .
1	set your mind on the things that are above , not on the things that are upon the earth .
1	for ye died , and your life is hid with christ in god .
1	when christ , who is our life , shall be manifested , then shall ye also with him be manifested in glory .
1	put to death therefore your members which are upon the earth : fornication , uncleanness , passion , evil desire , and covetousness , which is idolatry ;
1	for which things ’ sake cometh the wrath of god upon the sons of disobedience :
1	wherein ye also once walked , when ye lived in these things ;
1	but now do ye also put them all away : anger , wrath , malice , railing , shameful speaking out of your mouth :
1	lie not one to another ; seeing that ye have put off the old man with his doings ,
1	and have put on the new man , that is being renewed unto knowledge after the image of him that created him :
1	where there can not be greek and jew , circumcision and uncircumcision , barbarian , scythian , bondman , freeman ; but christ is all , and in all .
1	put on therefore , as god ’ s elect , holy and beloved , a heart of compassion , kindness , lowliness , meekness , longsuffering ;
1	forbearing one another , and forgiving each other , if any man have a complaint against any ; even as the lord forgave you , so also do ye :
1	and above all these things put on love , which is the bond of perfectness .
1	and let the peace of christ rule in your hearts , to the which also ye were called in one body ; and be ye thankful .
1	and whatsoever ye do , in word or in deed , do all in the name of the lord jesus , giving thanks to god the father through him .
1	wives , be in subjection to your husbands , as is fitting in the lord .
1	husbands , love your wives , and be not bitter against them .
1	children , obey your parents in all things , for this is well-pleasing in the lord .
1	fathers , provoke not your children , that they be not discouraged .
1	whatsoever ye do , work heartily , as unto the lord , and not unto men ;
1	knowing that from the lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance : ye serve the lord christ .
1	for he that doeth wrong shall receive again for the wrong that he hath done : and there is no respect of persons .
1	masters , render unto your servants that which is just and equal ; knowing that ye also have a master in heaven .
1	continue stedfastly in prayer , watching therein with thanksgiving ;
1	that i may make it manifest , as i ought to speak .
1	walk in wisdom toward them that are without , redeeming the time .
1	let your speech be always with grace , seasoned with salt , that ye may know how ye ought to answer each one .
1	all my affairs shall tychicus make known unto you , the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-servant in the lord :
1	whom i have sent unto you for this very purpose , that ye may know our state , and that he may comfort your hearts ;
1	together with onesimus , the faithful and beloved brother , who is one of you . they shall make known unto you all things that are done here .
1	aristarchus my fellow-prisoner saluteth you , and mark , the cousin of barnabas ( touching whom ye received commandments ; if he come unto you , receive him ) ,
1	for i bear him witness , that he hath much labor for you , and for them in laodicea , and for them in hierapolis .
1	luke , the beloved physician , and demas salute you .
1	salute the brethren that are in laodicea , and nymphas , and the church that is in their house .
1	and say to archippus , take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the lord , that thou fulfil it .
1	the salutation of me paul with mine own hand . remember my bonds . grace be with you .
1	paul , and silvanus , and timothy , unto the church of the thessalonians in god the father and the lord jesus christ : grace to you and peace .
1	we give thanks to god always for you all , making mention of you in our prayers ;
1	remembering without ceasing your work of faith and labor of love and patience of hope in our lord jesus christ , before our god and father ;
1	knowing , brethren beloved of god , your election ,
1	and ye became imitators of us , and of the lord , having received the word in much affliction , with joy of the holy spirit ;
1	so that ye became an ensample to all that believe in macedonia and in achaia .
1	and to wait for his son from heaven , whom he raised from the dead , even jesus , who delivereth us from the wrath to come .
1	for yourselves , brethren , know our entering in unto you , that it hath not been found vain :
1	for our exhortation is not of error , nor of uncleanness , nor in guile :
1	for neither at any time were we found using words of flattery , as ye know , nor a cloak of covetousness , god is witness ;
1	nor seeking glory of men , neither from you nor from others , when we might have claimed authority as apostles of christ .
1	but we were gentle in the midst of you , as when a nurse cherisheth her own children :
1	ye are witnesses , and god also , how holily and righteously and unblamably we behaved ourselves toward you that believe :
1	as ye know how we dealt with each one of you , as a father with his own children , exhorting you , and encouraging you , and testifying ,
1	to the end that ye should walk worthily of god , who calleth you into his own kingdom and glory .
1	who both killed the lord jesus and the prophets , and drove out us , and please not god , and are contrary to all men ;
1	because we would fain have come unto you , i paul once and again ; and satan hindered us .
1	for what is our hope , or joy , or crown of glorying ? are not even ye , before our lord jesus at his coming ?
1	for ye are our glory and our joy .
1	wherefore when we could no longer forbear , we thought it good to be left behind at athens alone ;
1	and sent timothy , our brother and god ’ s minister in the gospel of christ , to establish you , and to comfort you concerning your faith ;
1	that no man be moved by these afflictions ; for yourselves know that hereunto we are appointed .
1	for this cause , brethren , we were comforted over you in all our distress and affliction through your faith :
1	for now we live , if ye stand fast in the lord .
1	for what thanksgiving can we render again unto god for you , for all the joy wherewith we joy for your sakes before our god ;
1	night and day praying exceedingly that we may see your face , and may perfect that which is lacking in your faith ?
1	now may our god and father himself , and our lord jesus , direct our way unto you :
1	and the lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another , and toward all men , even as we also do toward you ;
1	to the end he may establish your hearts unblamable in holiness before our god and father , at the coming of our lord jesus with all his saints .
1	for ye know what charge we gave you through the lord jesus .
1	for this is the will of god , even your sanctification , that ye abstain from fornication ;
1	that each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel in sanctification and honor ,
1	not in the passion of lust , even as the gentiles who know not god ;
1	for god called us not for uncleanness , but in sanctification .
1	therefore he that rejecteth , rejecteth not man , but god , who giveth his holy spirit unto you .
1	but concerning love of the brethren ye have no need that one write unto you : for ye yourselves are taught of god to love one another ;
1	for indeed ye do it toward all the brethren that are in all macedonia . but we exhort you , brethren , that ye abound more and more ;
1	and that ye study to be quiet , and to do your own business , and to work with your hands , even as we charged you ;
1	that ye may walk becomingly toward them that are without , and may have need of nothing .
1	for if we believe that jesus died and rose again , even so them also that are fallen asleep in jesus will god bring with him .
1	wherefore comfort one another with these words .
1	but concerning the times and the seasons , brethren , ye have no need that aught be written unto you .
1	for yourselves know perfectly that the day of the lord so cometh as a thief in the night .
1	but ye , brethren , are not in darkness , that that day should overtake you as a thief :
1	for ye are all sons of light , and sons of the day : we are not of the night , nor of darkness ;
1	so then let us not sleep , as do the rest , but let us watch and be sober .
1	for they that sleep sleep in the night ; and they that are drunken are drunken in the night .
1	for god appointed us not unto wrath , but unto the obtaining of salvation through our lord jesus christ ,
1	who died for us , that , whether we wake or sleep , we should live together with him .
1	wherefore exhort one another , and build each other up , even as also ye do .
1	but we beseech you , brethren , to know them that labor among you , and are over you in the lord , and admonish you ;
1	and to esteem them exceeding highly in love for their work ’ s sake . be at peace among yourselves .
1	and we exhort you , brethren , admonish the disorderly , encourage the faint-hearted , support the weak , be longsuffering toward all .
1	see that none render unto any one evil for evil ; but always follow after that which is good , one toward another , and toward all .
1	in everything give thanks : for this is the will of god in christ jesus to you-ward .
1	quench not the spirit ;
1	prove all things ; hold fast that which is good ;
1	abstain from every form of evil .
1	faithful is he that calleth you , who will also do it .
1	brethren , pray for us .
1	salute all the brethren with a holy kiss .
1	i adjure you by the lord that this epistle be read unto all the brethren .
1	the grace of our lord jesus christ be with you .
1	paul , and silvanus , and timothy , unto the church of the thessalonians in god our father and the lord jesus christ ;
1	grace to you and peace from god the father and the lord jesus christ .
1	so that we ourselves glory in you in the churches of god for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which ye endure ;
1	if so be that it is a righteous thing with god to recompense affliction to them that afflict you ,
1	and to you that are afflicted rest with us , at the revelation of the lord jesus from heaven with the angels of his power in flaming fire ,
1	rendering vengeance to them that know not god , and to them that obey not the gospel of our lord jesus :
1	who shall suffer punishment , even eternal destruction from the face of the lord and from the glory of his might ,
1	now we beseech you , brethren , touching the coming of our lord jesus christ , and our gathering together unto him ;
1	remember ye not , that , when i was yet with you , i told you these things ?
1	and now ye know that which restraineth , to the end that he may be revealed in his own season .
1	for the mystery of lawlessness doth already work : only there is one that restraineth now , until he be taken out of the way .
1	even he , whose coming is according to the working of satan with all power and signs and lying wonders ,
1	and with all deceit of unrighteousness for them that perish ; because they received not the love of the truth , that they might be saved .
1	and for this cause god sendeth them a working of error , that they should believe a lie :
1	that they all might be judged who believed not the truth , but had pleasure in unrighteousness .
1	whereunto he called you through our gospel , to the obtaining of the glory of our lord jesus christ .
1	so then , brethren , stand fast , and hold the traditions which ye were taught , whether by word , or by epistle of ours .
1	now our lord jesus christ himself , and god our father who loved us and gave us eternal comfort and good hope through grace ,
1	comfort your hearts and establish them in every good work and word .
1	finally , brethren , pray for us , that the word of the lord may run and be glorified , even as also it is with you ;
1	and that we may be delivered from unreasonable and evil men ; for all have not faith .
1	but the lord is faithful , who shall establish you , and guard you from the evil one .
1	and we have confidence in the lord touching you , that ye both do and will do the things which we command .
1	and the lord direct your hearts into the love of god , and into the patience of christ .
1	for yourselves know how ye ought to imitate us : for we behaved not ourselves disorderly among you ;
1	not because we have not the right , but to make ourselves an ensample unto you , that ye should imitate us .
1	for even when we were with you , this we commanded you , if any will not work , neither let him eat .
1	for we hear of some that walk among you disorderly , that work not at all , but are busybodies .
1	now them that are such we command and exhort in the lord jesus christ , that with quietness they work , and eat their own bread .
1	but ye , brethren , be not weary in well-doing .
1	and yet count him not as an enemy , but admonish him as a brother .
1	now the lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways . the lord be with you all .
1	the salutation of me paul with mine own hand , which is the token in every epistle : so i write .
1	the grace of our lord jesus christ be with you all .
1	paul , an apostle of christ jesus according to the commandment of god our saviour , and christ jesus our hope ;
1	unto timothy , my true child in faith : grace , mercy , peace , from god the father and christ jesus our lord .
1	as i exhorted thee to tarry at ephesus , when i was going into macedonia , that thou mightest charge certain men not to teach a different doctrine ,
1	neither to give heed to fables and endless genealogies , which minister questionings , rather than a dispensation of god which is in faith ; so do i now .
1	but the end of the charge is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and faith unfeigned :
1	from which things some having swerved have turned aside unto vain talking ;
1	desiring to be teachers of the law , though they understand neither what they say , nor whereof they confidently affirm .
1	but we know that the law is good , if a man use it lawfully ,
1	according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed god , which was committed to my trust .
1	i thank him that enabled me , even christ jesus our lord , for that he counted me faithful , appointing me to his service ;
1	though i was before a blasphemer , and a persecutor , and injurious : howbeit i obtained mercy , because i did it ignorantly in unbelief ;
1	and the grace of our lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in christ jesus .
1	faithful is the saying , and worthy of all acceptation , that christ jesus came into the world to save sinners ; of whom i am chief :
1	now unto the king eternal , immortal , invisible , the only god , be honor and glory for ever and ever . amen .
1	holding faith and a good conscience ; which some having thrust from them made shipwreck concerning the faith :
1	of whom is hymenaeus and alexander ; whom i delivered unto satan , that they might be taught not to blaspheme .
1	i exhort therefore , first of all , that supplications , prayers , intercessions , thanksgivings , be made for all men ;
1	for kings and all that are in high place ; that we may lead a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and gravity .
1	this is good and acceptable in the sight of god our saviour ;
1	who would have all men to be saved , and come to the knowledge of the truth .
1	for there is one god , one mediator also between god and men , himself man , christ jesus ,
1	who gave himself a ransom for all ; the testimony to be borne in its own times ;
1	whereunto i was appointed a preacher and an apostle ( i speak the truth , i lie not ) , a teacher of the gentiles in faith and truth .
1	i desire therefore that the men pray in every place , lifting up holy hands , without wrath and disputing .
1	in like manner , that women adorn themselves in modest apparel , with shamefastness and sobriety ; not with braided hair , and gold or pearls or costly raiment ;
1	but ( which becometh women professing godliness ) through good works .
1	let a woman learn in quietness with all subjection .
1	but i permit not a woman to teach , nor to have dominion over a man , but to be in quietness .
1	for adam was first formed , then eve ;
1	and adam was not beguiled , but the woman being beguiled hath fallen into transgression :
1	but she shall be saved through her child-bearing , if they continue in faith and love and sanctification with sobriety .
1	faithful is the saying , if a man seeketh the office of a bishop , he desireth a good work .
1	the bishop therefore must be without reproach , the husband of one wife , temperate , sober-minded , orderly , given to hospitality , apt to teach ;
1	no brawler , no striker ; but gentle , not contentious , no lover of money ;
1	one that ruleth well his own house , having his children in subjection with all gravity ;
1	( but if a man knoweth not how to rule his own house , how shall he take care of the church of god ? )
1	not a novice , lest being puffed up he fall into the condemnation of the devil .
1	moreover he must have good testimony from them that are without ; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil .
1	deacons in like manner must be grave , not double-tongued , not given to much wine , not greedy of filthy lucre ;
1	holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience .
1	and let these also first be proved ; then let them serve as deacons , if they be blameless .
1	women in like manner must be grave , not slanderers , temperate , faithful in all things .
1	let deacons be husbands of one wife , ruling their children and their own houses well .
1	for they that have served well as deacons gain to themselves a good standing , and great boldness in the faith which is in christ jesus .
1	these things write i unto thee , hoping to come unto thee shortly ;
1	and without controversy great is the mystery of godliness ;
1	but the spirit saith expressly , that in later times some shall fall away from the faith , giving heed to seducing spirits and doctrines of demons ,
