1	through the hypocrisy of men that speak lies , branded in their own conscience as with a hot iron ;
1	forbidding to marry , and commanding to abstain from meats , which god created to be received with thanksgiving by them that believe and know the truth .
1	for every creature of god is good , and nothing is to be rejected , if it be received with thanksgiving :
1	for it is sanctified through the word of god and prayer .
1	but refuse profane and old wives ’ fables . and exercise thyself unto godliness :
1	faithful is the saying , and worthy of all acceptation .
1	these things command and teach .
1	till i come , give heed to reading , to exhortation , to teaching .
1	neglect not the gift that is in thee , which was given thee by prophecy , with the laying on of the hands of the presbytery .
1	be diligent in these things ; give thyself wholly to them ; that thy progress may be manifest unto all .
1	take heed to thyself , and to thy teaching . continue in these things ; for in doing this thou shalt save both thyself and them that hear thee .
1	rebuke not an elder , but exhort him as a father ; the younger men as brethren :
1	the elder women as mothers ; the younger as sisters , in all purity .
1	honor widows that are widows indeed .
1	now she that is a widow indeed , and desolate , hath her hope set on god , and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day .
1	but she that giveth herself to pleasure is dead while she liveth .
1	these things also command , that they may be without reproach .
1	but if any provideth not for his own , and specially his own household , he hath denied the faith , and is worse than an unbeliever .
1	let none be enrolled as a widow under threescore years old , having been the wife of one man ,
1	but younger widows refuse : for when they have waxed wanton against christ , they desire to marry ;
1	having condemnation , because they have rejected their first pledge .
1	i desire therefore that the younger widows marry , bear children , rule the household , give no occasion to the adversary for reviling :
1	for already some are turned aside after satan .
1	let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honor , especially those who labor in the word and in teaching .
1	for the scripture saith , thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn . and , the laborer is worthy of his hire .
1	against an elder receive not an accusation , except at the mouth of two or three witnesses .
1	them that sin reprove in the sight of all , that the rest also may be in fear .
1	lay hands hastily on no man , neither be partaker of other men ’ s sins : keep thyself pure .
1	be no longer a drinker of water , but use a little wine for thy stomach ’ s sake and thine often infirmities .
1	some men ’ s sins are evident , going before unto judgment ; and some men also they follow after .
1	in like manner also there are good works that are evident ; and such as are otherwise can not be hid .
1	let as many as are servants under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honor , that the name of god and the doctrine be not blasphemed .
1	he is puffed up , knowing nothing , but doting about questionings and disputes of words , whereof cometh envy , strife , railings , evil surmisings ,
1	wranglings of men corrupted in mind and bereft of the truth , supposing that godliness is a way of gain .
1	but godliness with contentment is great gain :
1	for we brought nothing into the world , for neither can we carry anything out ;
1	but having food and covering we shall be therewith content .
1	but thou , o man of god , flee these things ; and follow after righteousness , godliness , faith , love , patience , meekness .
1	i charge thee in the sight of god , who giveth life to all things , and of christ jesus , who before pontius pilate witnessed the good confession ;
1	that thou keep the commandment , without spot , without reproach , until the appearing of our lord jesus christ :
1	which in its own times he shall show , who is the blessed and only potentate , the king of kings , and lord of lords ;
1	who only hath immortality , dwelling in light unapproachable ; whom no man hath seen , nor can see : to whom be honor and power eternal . amen .
1	that they do good , that they be rich in good works , that they be ready to distribute , willing to communicate ;
1	laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come , that they may lay hold on the life which is life indeed .
1	o timothy , guard that which is committed unto thee , turning away from the profane babblings and oppositions of the knowledge which is falsely so called ;
1	which some professing have erred concerning the faith .
1	paul , an apostle of christ jesus through the will of god , according to the promise of the life which is in christ jesus ,
1	to timothy , my beloved child : grace , mercy , peace , from god the father and christ jesus our lord .
1	i thank god , whom i serve from my forefathers in a pure conscience , how unceasing is my remembrance of thee in my supplications , night and day
1	longing to see thee , remembering thy tears , that i may be filled with joy ;
1	for which cause i put thee in remembrance that thou stir up the gift of god , which is in thee through the laying on of my hands .
1	for god gave us not a spirit of fearfulness ; but of power and love and discipline .
1	be not ashamed therefore of the testimony of our lord , nor of me his prisoner : but suffer hardship with the gospel according to the power of god ;
1	but hath now been manifested by the appearing of our saviour christ jesus , who abolished death , and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel ,
1	whereunto i was appointed a preacher , and an apostle , and a teacher .
1	hold the pattern of sound words which thou hast heard from me , in faith and love which is in christ jesus .
1	that good thing which was committed unto thee guard through the holy spirit which dwelleth in us .
1	this thou knowest , that all that are in asia turned away from me ; of whom are phygelus and hermogenes .
1	the lord grant mercy unto the house of onesiphorus : for he oft refreshed me , and was not ashamed of my chain ;
1	but , when he was in rome , he sought me diligently , and found me
1	thou therefore , my child , be strengthened in the grace that is in christ jesus .
1	and the things which thou hast heard from me among many witnesses , the same commit thou to faithful men , who shall be able to teach others also .
1	suffer hardship with me , as a good soldier of christ jesus .
1	no soldier on service entangleth himself in the affairs of this life ; that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier .
1	and if also a man contend in the games , he is not crowned , except he have contended lawfully .
1	the husbandman that laboreth must be the first to partake of the fruits .
1	consider what i say ; for the lord shall give thee understanding in all things .
1	remember jesus christ , risen from the dead , of the seed of david , according to my gospel :
1	wherein i suffer hardship unto bonds , as a malefactor ; but the word of god is not bound .
1	therefore i endure all things for the elect ’ s sake , that they also may obtain the salvation which is in christ jesus with eternal glory .
1	faithful is the saying : for if we died with him , we shall also live with him :
1	if we endure , we shall also reign with him : if we shall deny him , he also will deny us :
1	if we are faithless , he abideth faithful ; for he can not deny himself .
1	give diligence to present thyself approved unto god , a workman that needeth not to be ashamed , handling aright the word of truth .
1	but shun profane babblings : for they will proceed further in ungodliness ,
1	and their word will eat as doth a gangrene : of whom is hymenaeus and philetus ;
1	men who concerning the truth have erred , saying that the resurrection is past already , and overthrow the faith of some .
1	but flee youthful lusts , and follow after righteousness , faith , love , peace , with them that call on the lord out of a pure heart .
1	but foolish and ignorant questionings refuse , knowing that they gender strifes .
1	and the lord ’ s servant must not strive , but be gentle towards all , apt to teach , forbearing ,
1	in meekness correcting them that oppose themselves ; if peradventure god may give them repentance unto the knowledge of the truth ,
1	and they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil , having been taken captive by him unto his will .
1	but know this , that in the last days grievous times shall come .
1	for men shall be lovers of self , lovers of money , boastful , haughty , railers , disobedient to parents , unthankful , unholy ,
1	without natural affection , implacable , slanderers , without self-control , fierce , no lovers of good ,
1	traitors , headstrong , puffed up , lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of god ;
1	holding a form of godliness , but having denied the power thereof : from these also turn away .
1	for of these are they that creep into houses , and take captive silly women laden with sins , led away by divers lusts ,
1	ever learning , and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth .
1	and even as jannes and jambres withstood moses , so do these also withstand the truth ; men corrupted in mind , reprobate concerning the faith .
1	but they shall proceed no further : for their folly shall be evident unto all men , as theirs also came to be .
1	but thou didst follow my teaching , conduct , purpose , faith , longsuffering , love , patience ,
1	yea , and all that would live godly in christ jesus shall suffer persecution .
1	but evil men and impostors shall wax worse and worse , deceiving and being deceived .
1	but abide thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of , knowing of whom thou hast learned them ;
1	and that from a babe thou hast known the sacred writings which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in christ jesus .
1	every scripture inspired of god is also profitable for teaching , for reproof , for correction , for instruction which is in righteousness :
1	that the man of god may be complete , furnished completely unto every good work .
1	preach the word ; be urgent in season , out of season ; reprove , rebuke , exhort , with all longsuffering and teaching .
1	for the time will come when they will not endure the sound doctrine ; but , having itching ears , will heap to themselves teachers after their own lusts ;
1	and will turn away their ears from the truth , and turn aside unto fables .
1	but be thou sober in all things , suffer hardship , do the work of an evangelist , fulfil thy ministry .
1	for i am already being offered , and the time of my departure is come .
1	i have fought the good fight , i have finished the course , i have kept the faith :
1	give diligence to come shortly unto me :
1	for demas forsook me , having loved this present world , and went to thessalonica ; crescens to galatia , titus to dalmatia .
1	only luke is with me . take mark , and bring him with thee ; for he is useful to me for ministering .
1	but tychicus i sent to ephesus .
1	the cloak that i left at troas with carpus , bring when thou comest , and the books , especially the parchments .
1	alexander the coppersmith did me much evil : the lord will render to him according to his works :
1	of whom do thou also beware ; for he greatly withstood our words .
1	at my first defence no one took my part , but all forsook me : may it not be laid to their account .
1	salute prisca and aquila , and the house of onesiphorus .
1	erastus remained at corinth : but trophimus i left at miletus sick .
1	give diligence to come before winter . eubulus saluteth thee , and pudens , and linus , and claudia , and all the brethren .
1	the lord be with thy spirit . grace be with you .
1	in the third year of the reign of jehoiakim king of judah came nebuchadnezzar king of babylon unto jerusalem , and besieged it .
1	now among these were , of the children of judah , daniel , hananiah , mishael , and azariah .
1	now god made daniel to find kindness and compassion in the sight of the prince of the eunuchs .
1	then said daniel to the steward whom the prince of the eunuchs had appointed over daniel , hananiah , mishael , and azariah :
1	prove thy servants , i beseech thee , ten days ; and let them give us pulse to eat , and water to drink .
1	so he hearkened unto them in this matter , and proved them ten days .
1	so the steward took away their dainties , and the wine that they should drink , and gave them pulse .
1	now as for these four youths , god gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom : and daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams .
1	and at the end of the days which the king had appointed for bringing them in , the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before nebuchadnezzar .
1	and daniel continued even unto the first year of king cyrus .
1	and in the second year of the reign of nebuchadnezzar , nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams ; and his spirit was troubled , and his sleep went from him .
1	and the king said unto them , i have dreamed a dream , and my spirit is troubled to know the dream .
1	they answered the second time and said , let the king tell his servants the dream , and we will show the interpretation .
1	the king answered and said , i know of a certainty that ye would gain time , because ye see the thing is gone from me .
1	for this cause the king was angry and very furious , and commanded to destroy all the wise men of babylon .
1	so the decree went forth , and the wise men were to be slain ; and they sought daniel and his companions to be slain .
1	and daniel went in , and desired of the king that he would appoint him a time , and he would show the king the interpretation .
1	then daniel went to his house , and made the thing known to hananiah , mishael , and azariah , his companions :
1	then was the secret revealed unto daniel in a vision of the night . then daniel blessed the god of heaven .
1	daniel answered and said , blessed be the name of god for ever and ever ; for wisdom and might are his .
1	he revealeth the deep and secret things ; he knoweth what is in the darkness , and the light dwelleth with him .
1	as for this image , its head was of fine gold , its breast and its arms of silver , its belly and its thighs of brass ,
1	its legs of iron , its feet part of iron , and part of clay .
1	this is the dream ; and we will tell the interpretation thereof before the king .
1	and after thee shall arise another kingdom inferior to thee ; and another third kingdom of brass , which shall bear rule over all the earth .
1	and as the toes of the feet were part of iron , and part of clay , so the kingdom shall be partly strong , and partly broken .
1	then the king nebuchadnezzar fell upon his face , and worshipped daniel , and commanded that they should offer an oblation and sweet odors unto him .
1	then the herald cried aloud , to you it is commanded , o peoples , nations , and languages ,
1	and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace .
1	wherefore at that time certain chaldeans came near , and brought accusation against the jews .
1	they answered and said to nebuchadnezzar the king , o king , live for ever .
1	and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth , shall be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace .
1	then nebuchadnezzar in his rage and fury commanded to bring shadrach , meshach , and abed-nego . then they brought these men before the king .
1	shadrach , meshach , and abed-nego answered and said to the king , o nebuchadnezzar , we have no need to answer thee in this matter .
1	and he commanded certain mighty men that were in his army to bind shadrach , meshach , and abed-nego , and to cast them into the burning fiery furnace .
1	and these three men , shadrach , meshach , and abed-nego , fell down bound into the midst of the burning fiery furnace .
1	then the king promoted shadrach , meshach , and abed-nego in the province of babylon .
1	nebuchadnezzar the king , unto all the peoples , nations , and languages , that dwell in all the earth : peace be multiplied unto you .
1	it hath seemed good unto me to show the signs and wonders that the most high god hath wrought toward me .
1	how great are his signs ! and how mighty are his wonders ! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom , and his dominion is from generation to generation .
1	i , nebuchadnezzar , was at rest in my house , and flourishing in my palace .
1	i saw a dream which made me afraid ; and the thoughts upon my bed and the visions of my head troubled me .
1	therefore made i a decree to bring in all the wise men of babylon before me , that they might make known unto me the interpretation of the dream .
1	the tree grew , and was strong , and the height thereof reached unto heaven , and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth .
1	i saw in the visions of my head upon my bed , and , behold , a watcher and a holy one came down from heaven .
1	let his heart be changed from man ’ s , and let a beast ’ s heart be given unto him ; and let seven times pass over him .
1	the tree that thou sawest , which grew , and was strong , whose height reached unto heaven , and the sight thereof to all the earth ;
1	this is the interpretation , o king , and it is the decree of the most high , which is come upon my lord the king :
1	all this came upon the king nebuchadnezzar .
1	at the end of twelve months he was walking in the royal palace of babylon .
1	belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of his lords , and drank wine before the thousand .
1	they drank wine , and praised the gods of gold , and of silver , of brass , of iron , of wood , and of stone .
1	then came in all the king ’ s wise men ; but they could not read the writing , nor make known to the king the interpretation .
1	then was king belshazzar greatly troubled , and his countenance was changed in him , and his lords were perplexed .
1	i have heard of thee , that the spirit of the gods is in thee , and that light and understanding and excellent wisdom are found in thee .
1	o thou king , the most high god gave nebuchadnezzar thy father the kingdom , and greatness , and glory , and majesty :
1	and thou his son , o belshazzar , hast not humbled thy heart , though thou knewest all this ,
1	then was the part of the hand sent from before him , and this writing was inscribed .
1	and this is the writing that was inscribed : mene , mene , tekel , upharsin .
1	this is the interpretation of the thing : mene ; god hath numbered thy kingdom , and brought it to an end .
1	tekel ; thou art weighed in the balances , and art found wanting .
1	peres ; thy kingdom is divided , and given to the medes and persians .
1	in that night belshazzar the chaldean king was slain .
1	and darius the mede received the kingdom , being about threescore and two years old .
1	it pleased darius to set over the kingdom a hundred and twenty satraps , who should be throughout the whole kingdom ;
1	and over them three presidents , of whom daniel was one ; that these satraps might give account unto them , and that the king should have no damage .
1	then said these men , we shall not find any occasion against this daniel , except we find it against him concerning the law of his god .
1	then these presidents and satraps assembled together to the king , and said thus unto him , king darius , live for ever .
1	wherefore king darius signed the writing and the interdict .
1	then these men assembled together , and found daniel making petition and supplication before his god .
1	then the king went to his palace , and passed the night fasting ; neither were instruments of music brought before him : and his sleep fled from him .
1	then the king arose very early in the morning , and went in haste unto the den of lions .
1	then said daniel unto the king , o king , live for ever .
1	then king darius wrote unto all the peoples , nations , and languages , that dwell in all the earth : peace be multiplied unto you .
1	he delivereth and rescueth , and he worketh signs and wonders in heaven and in earth , who hath delivered daniel from the power of the lions .
1	so this daniel prospered in the reign of darius , and in the reign of cyrus the persian .
1	daniel spake and said , i saw in my vision by night , and , behold , the four winds of heaven brake forth upon the great sea .
1	and four great beasts came up from the sea , diverse one from another .
1	and as for the rest of the beasts , their dominion was taken away : yet their lives were prolonged for a season and a time .
1	as for me , daniel , my spirit was grieved in the midst of my body , and the visions of my head troubled me .
1	these great beasts , which are four , are four kings , that shall arise out of the earth .
1	but the saints of the most high shall receive the kingdom , and possess the kingdom for ever , even for ever and ever .
1	i beheld , and the same horn made war with the saints , and prevailed against them ;
1	until the ancient of days came , and judgment was given to the saints of the most high , and the time came that the saints possessed the kingdom .
1	but the judgment shall be set , and they shall take away his dominion , to consume and to destroy it unto the end .
1	and he said unto me , unto two thousand and three hundred evenings and mornings ; then shall the sanctuary be cleansed .
1	the ram which thou sawest , that had the two horns , they are the kings of media and persia .
1	and the rough he-goat is the king of greece : and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king .
1	in the first year of darius the son of ahasuerus , of the seed of the medes , who was made king over the realm of the chaldeans ,
1	and i set my face unto the lord god , to seek by prayer and supplications , with fasting and sackcloth and ashes .
1	we have sinned , and have dealt perversely , and have done wickedly , and have rebelled , even turning aside from thy precepts and from thine ordinances ;
1	o lord , to us belongeth confusion of face , to our kings , to our princes , and to our fathers , because we have sinned against thee .
1	to the lord our god belong mercies and forgiveness ; for we have rebelled against him ;
1	neither have we obeyed the voice of jehovah our god , to walk in his laws , which he set before us by his servants the prophets .
1	and he instructed me , and talked with me , and said , o daniel , i am now come forth to give thee wisdom and understanding .
1	in those days i , daniel , was mourning three whole weeks .
1	i ate no pleasant bread , neither came flesh nor wine into my mouth , neither did i anoint myself at all , till three whole weeks were fulfilled .
1	and in the four and twentieth day of the first month , as i was by the side of the great river , which is hiddekel ,

1	and , behold , a hand touched me , which set me upon my knees and upon the palms of my hands .

1	and when he had spoken unto me according to these words , i set my face toward the ground , and was dumb .
1	then there touched me again one like the appearance of a man , and he strengthened me .
1	and as for me , in the first year of darius the mede , i stood up to confirm and strengthen him .
1	and a mighty king shall stand up , that shall rule with great dominion , and do according to his will .
1	and he shall come into the realm of the king of the south , but he shall return into his own land .
1	and the multitude shall be lifted up , and his heart shall be exalted ; and he shall cast down tens of thousands , but he shall not prevail .
1	then he shall turn his face toward the fortresses of his own land ; but he shall stumble and fall , and shall not be found .
1	and the overwhelming forces shall be overwhelmed from before him , and shall be broken ; yea , also the prince of the covenant .
1	and after the league made with him he shall work deceitfully ; for he shall come up , and shall become strong , with a small people .
1	yea , they that eat of his dainties shall destroy him , and his army shall overflow ; and many shall fall down slain .
1	at the time appointed he shall return , and come into the south ; but it shall not be in the latter time as it was in the former .
1	and such as do wickedly against the covenant shall he pervert by flatteries ; but the people that know their god shall be strong , and do exploits .
1	now when they shall fall , they shall be helped with a little help ; but many shall join themselves unto them with flatteries .
1	neither shall he regard the gods of his fathers , nor the desire of women , nor regard any god ; for he shall magnify himself above all .
1	he shall stretch forth his hand also upon the countries ; and the land of egypt shall not escape .
1	and many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake , some to everlasting life , and some to shame and everlasting contempt .
1	and they that are wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament ; and they that turn many to righteousness as the stars for ever and ever .
1	and i heard , but i understood not : then said i , o my lord , what shall be the issue of these things ?
1	and he said , go thy way , daniel ; for the words are shut up and sealed till the time of the end .

1	i the preacher was king over israel in jerusalem .
1	i have seen all the works that are done under the sun ; and , behold , all is vanity and a striving after wind .
1	that which is crooked can not be made straight ; and that which is wanting can not be numbered .
1	and i applied my heart to know wisdom , and to know madness and folly : i perceived that this also was a striving after wind .
1	for in much wisdom is much grief ; and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow .
1	i said in my heart , come now , i will prove thee with mirth ; therefore enjoy pleasure : and , behold , this also was vanity .
1	i said of laughter , it is mad ; and of mirth , what doeth it ?
1	i made me great works ; i builded me houses ; i planted me vineyards ;
1	i made me gardens and parks , and i planted trees in them of all kinds of fruit ;
1	i made me pools of water , to water therefrom the forest where trees were reared ;
1	so i was great , and increased more than all that were before me in jerusalem : also my wisdom remained with me .
1	then i saw that wisdom excelleth folly , as far as light excelleth darkness .
1	the wise man ’ s eyes are in his head , and the fool walketh in darkness : and yet i perceived that one event happeneth to them all .
1	so i hated life , because the work that is wrought under the sun was grievous unto me ; for all is vanity and a striving after wind .
1	and i hated all my labor wherein i labored under the sun , seeing that i must leave it unto the man that shall be after me .
1	therefore i turned about to cause my heart to despair concerning all the labor wherein i had labored under the sun .
1	for what hath a man of all his labor , and of the striving of his heart , wherein he laboreth under the sun ?
1	for who can eat , or who can have enjoyment , more than i ?
1	for everything there is a season , and a time for every purpose under heaven :
1	a time to be born , and a time to die ; a time to plant , and a time to pluck up that which is planted ;
1	a time to kill , and a time to heal ; a time to break down , and a time to build up ;
1	a time to weep , and a time to laugh ; a time to mourn , and a time to dance ;
1	a time to cast away stones , and a time to gather stones together ; a time to embrace , and a time to refrain from embracing ;
1	a time to seek , and a time to lose ; a time to keep , and a time to cast away ;
1	a time to rend , and a time to sew ; a time to keep silence , and a time to speak ;
1	a time to love , and a time to hate ; a time for war , and a time for peace .
1	what profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboreth ?
1	i have seen the travail which god hath given to the sons of men to be exercised therewith .
1	i know that there is nothing better for them , than to rejoice , and to do good so long as they live .
1	and also that every man should eat and drink , and enjoy good in all his labor , is the gift of god .
1	that which is hath been long ago ; and that which is to be hath long ago been : and god seeketh again that which is passed away .
1	i said in my heart , god will judge the righteous and the wicked ; for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work .
1	all go unto one place ; all are of the dust , and all turn to dust again .
1	who knoweth the spirit of man , whether it goeth upward , and the spirit of the beast , whether it goeth downward to the earth ?
1	wherefore i praised the dead that have been long dead more than the living that are yet alive ;
1	yea , better than them both did i esteem him that hath not yet been , who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun .
1	the fool foldeth his hands together , and eateth his own flesh .
1	better is a handful , with quietness , than two handfuls with labor and striving after wind .
1	then i returned and saw vanity under the sun .
1	two are better than one , because they have a good reward for their labor .
1	again , if two lie together , then they have warmth ; but how can one be warm alone ?
1	and if a man prevail against him that is alone , two shall withstand him ; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken .
1	better is a poor and wise youth than an old and foolish king , who knoweth not how to receive admonition any more .
1	for out of prison he came forth to be king ; yea , even in his kingdom he was born poor .
1	i saw all the living that walk under the sun , that they were with the youth , the second , that stood up in his stead .
1	for a dream cometh with a multitude of business , and a fool ’ s voice with a multitude of words .
1	when thou vowest a vow unto god , defer not to pay it ; for he hath no pleasure in fools : pay that which thou vowest .
1	better is it that thou shouldest not vow , than that thou shouldest vow and not pay .
1	for in the multitude of dreams there are vanities , and in many words : but fear thou god .
1	moreover the profit of the earth is for all : the king himself is served by the field .
1	he that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver ; nor he that loveth abundance , with increase : this also is vanity .
1	when goods increase , they are increased that eat them ; and what advantage is there to the owner thereof , save the beholding of them with his eyes ?
1	the sleep of a laboring man is sweet , whether he eat little or much ; but the fulness of the rich will not suffer him to sleep .
1	there is a grievous evil which i have seen under the sun , namely , riches kept by the owner thereof to his hurt :
1	and those riches perish by evil adventure ; and if he hath begotten a son , there is nothing in his hand .
1	all his days also he eateth in darkness , and he is sore vexed , and hath sickness and wrath .
1	for he shall not much remember the days of his life ; because god answereth him in the joy of his heart .
1	there is an evil which i have seen under the sun , and it is heavy upon men :
1	for it cometh in vanity , and departeth in darkness , and the name thereof is covered with darkness ;
1	moreover it hath not seen the sun nor known it ; this hath rest rather than the other :
1	yea , though he live a thousand years twice told , and yet enjoy no good , do not all go to one place ?
1	all the labor of man is for his mouth , and yet the appetite is not filled .
1	for what advantage hath the wise more than the fool ? or what hath the poor man , that knoweth how to walk before the living ?
1	better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire : this also is vanity and a striving after wind .
1	seeing there are many things that increase vanity , what is man the better ?
1	a good name is better than precious oil ; and the day of death , than the day of one ’ s birth .
1	sorrow is better than laughter ; for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made glad .
1	the heart of the wise is in the house of mourning ; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth .
1	it is better to hear the rebuke of the wise , than for a man to hear the song of fools .
1	for as the crackling of thorns under a pot , so is the laughter of the fool : this also is vanity .
1	surely extortion maketh the wise man foolish ; and a bribe destroyeth the understanding .
1	better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof ; and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit .
1	be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry ; for anger resteth in the bosom of fools .
1	say not thou , what is the cause that the former days were better than these ? for thou dost not inquire wisely concerning this .
1	wisdom is as good as an inheritance ; yea , more excellent is it for them that see the sun .
1	consider the work of god : for who can make that straight , which he hath made crooked ?
1	be not righteous overmuch ; neither make thyself overwise : why shouldest thou destroy thyself ?
1	be not overmuch wicked , neither be thou foolish : why shouldest thou die before thy time ?
1	wisdom is a strength to the wise man more than ten rulers that are in a city .
1	surely there is not a righteous man upon earth , that doeth good , and sinneth not .
1	also take not heed unto all words that are spoken , lest thou hear thy servant curse thee ;
1	for oftentimes also thine own heart knoweth that thou thyself likewise hast cursed others .
1	all this have i proved in wisdom : i said , i will be wise ; but it was far from me .
1	that which is , is far off and exceeding deep ; who can find it out ?
1	behold , this have i found , saith the preacher , laying one thing to another , to find out the account ;
1	behold , this only have i found : that god made man upright ; but they have sought out many inventions .
1	i counsel thee , keep the king ’ s command , and that in regard of the oath of god .
1	be not hasty to go out of his presence ; persist not in an evil thing : for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him .
1	for the king ’ s word hath power ; and who may say unto him , what doest thou ?
1	whoso keepeth the commandment shall know no evil thing ; and a wise man ’ s heart discerneth time and judgment :
1	for to every purpose there is a time and judgment ; because the misery of man is great upon him :
1	for he knoweth not that which shall be ; for who can tell him how it shall be ?
1	because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily , therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil .
1	but it shall not be well with the wicked , neither shall he prolong his days , which are as a shadow ; because he feareth not before god .
1	for to him that is joined with all the living there is hope ; for a living dog is better than a dead lion .
1	go thy way , eat thy bread with joy , and drink thy wine with a merry heart ; for god hath already accepted thy works .
1	let thy garments be always white ; and let not thy head lack oil .
1	i have also seen wisdom under the sun on this wise , and it seemed great unto me :
1	now there was found in it a poor wise man , and he by his wisdom delivered the city ; yet no man remembered that same poor man .
1	then said i , wisdom is better than strength : nevertheless the poor man ’ s wisdom is despised , and his words are not heard .
1	the words of the wise heard in quiet are better than the cry of him that ruleth among fools .
1	wisdom is better than weapons of war ; but one sinner destroyeth much good .
1	dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to send forth an evil odor ; so doth a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor .
1	a wise man ’ s heart is at his right hand ; but a fool ’ s heart at his left .
1	yea also , when the fool walketh by the way , his understanding faileth him , and he saith to every one that he is a fool .
1	if the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee , leave not thy place ; for gentleness allayeth great offences .
1	there is an evil which i have seen under the sun , as it were an error which proceedeth from the ruler :
1	folly is set in great dignity , and the rich sit in a low place .
1	i have seen servants upon horses , and princes walking like servants upon the earth .
1	he that diggeth a pit shall fall into it ; and whoso breaketh through a wall , a serpent shall bite him .
1	whoso heweth out stones shall be hurt therewith ; and he that cleaveth wood is endangered thereby .
1	if the iron be blunt , and one do not whet the edge , then must he put to more strength : but wisdom is profitable to direct .
1	if the serpent bite before it is charmed , then is there no advantage in the charmer .
1	the words of a wise man ’ s mouth are gracious ; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself .
1	the beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness ; and the end of his talk is mischievous madness .
1	a fool also multiplieth words : yet man knoweth not what shall be ; and that which shall be after him , who can tell him ?
1	the labor of fools wearieth every one of them ; for he knoweth not how to go to the city .
1	woe to thee , o land , when thy king is a child , and thy princes eat in the morning !
1	by slothfulness the roof sinketh in ; and through idleness of the hands the house leaketh .
1	a feast is made for laughter , and wine maketh glad the life ; and money answereth all things .
1	cast thy bread upon the waters ; for thou shalt find it after many days .
1	give a portion to seven , yea , even unto eight ; for thou knowest not what evil shall be upon the earth .
1	he that observeth the wind shall not sow ; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap .
1	truly the light is sweet , and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to behold the sun .
1	therefore remove sorrow from thy heart , and put away evil from thy flesh ; for youth and the dawn of life are vanity .
1	before the sun , and the light , and the moon , and the stars , are darkened , and the clouds return after the rain ;
1	and the dust returneth to the earth as it was , and the spirit returneth unto god who gave it .
1	vanity of vanities , saith the preacher ; all is vanity .
1	the preacher sought to find out acceptable words , and that which was written uprightly , even words of truth .
1	the words of the wise are as goads ; and as nails well fastened are the words of the masters of assemblies , which are given from one shepherd .
1	and furthermore , my son , be admonished : of making many books there is no end ; and much study is a weariness of the flesh .
1	this is the end of the matter ; all hath been heard : fear god , and keep his commandments ; for this is the whole duty of man .
1	for god will bring every work into judgment , with every hidden thing , whether it be good , or whether it be evil .
1	paul , an apostle of christ jesus through the will of god , to the saints that are at ephesus , and the faithful in christ jesus :
1	grace to you and peace from god our father and the lord jesus christ .
1	blessed be the god and father of our lord jesus christ , who hath blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in christ :
1	even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world , that we should be holy and without blemish before him in love :
1	having foreordained us unto adoption as sons through jesus christ unto himself , according to the good pleasure of his will ,
1	to the praise of the glory of his grace , which he freely bestowed on us in the beloved :
1	in whom we have our redemption through his blood , the forgiveness of our trespasses , according to the riches of his grace ,
1	which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence ,
1	making known unto us the mystery of his will , according to his good pleasure which he purposed in him
1	in whom also we were made a heritage , having been foreordained according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his will ;
1	to the end that we should be unto the praise of his glory , we who had before hoped in christ :
1	which is an earnest of our inheritance , unto the redemption of god ’ s own possession , unto the praise of his glory .
1	cease not to give thanks for you , making mention of you in my prayers ;
1	that the god of our lord jesus christ , the father of glory , may give unto you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him ;
1	and what the exceeding greatness of his power to us-ward who believe , according to that working of the strength of his might
1	which he wrought in christ , when he raised him from the dead , and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places ,
1	and he put all things in subjection under his feet , and gave him to be head over all things to the church ,
1	which is his body , the fulness of him that filleth all in all .
1	and you did he make alive , when ye were dead through your trespasses and sins ,
1	but god , being rich in mercy , for his great love wherewith he loved us ,
1	even when we were dead through our trespasses , made us alive together with christ ( by grace have ye been saved ) ,
1	and raised us up with him , and made us to sit with him in the heavenly places , in christ jesus :
1	that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in christ jesus :
1	for by grace have ye been saved through faith ; and that not of yourselves , it is the gift of god ;
1	not of works , that no man should glory .
1	for we are his workmanship , created in christ jesus for good works , which god afore prepared that we should walk in them .
1	but now in christ jesus ye that once were far off are made nigh in the blood of christ .
1	for he is our peace , who made both one , and brake down the middle wall of partition ,
1	and might reconcile them both in one body unto god through the cross , having slain the enmity thereby :
1	and he came and preached peace to you that were far off , and peace to them that were nigh :
1	for through him we both have our access in one spirit unto the father .
1	so then ye are no more strangers and sojourners , but ye are fellow-citizens with the saints , and of the household of god ,
1	being built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets , christ jesus himself being the chief corner stone ;
1	in whom each several building , fitly framed together , groweth into a holy temple in the lord ;
1	in whom ye also are builded together for a habitation of god in the spirit .
1	for this cause i paul , the prisoner of christ jesus in behalf of you gentiles , —
1	if so be that ye have heard of the dispensation of that grace of god which was given me to you-ward ;
1	how that by revelation was made known unto me the mystery , as i wrote before in few words ,
1	whereby , when ye read , ye can perceive my understanding in the mystery of christ ;
1	which in other generations was not made known unto the sons of men , as it hath now been revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets in the spirit ;
1	to wit , that the gentiles are fellow-heirs , and fellow-members of the body , and fellow-partakers of the promise in christ jesus through the gospel ,
1	whereof i was made a minister , according to the gift of that grace of god which was given me according to the working of his power .
1	unto me , who am less than the least of all saints , was this grace given , to preach unto the gentiles the unsearchable riches of christ ;
1	and to make all men see what is the dispensation of the mystery which for ages hath been hid in god who created all things ;
1	to the intent that now unto the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places might be made known through the church the manifold wisdom of god ,
1	according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in christ jesus our lord :
1	in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him .
1	wherefore i ask that ye may not faint at my tribulations for you , which are your glory .
1	for this cause i bow my knees unto the father ,
1	from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named ,
1	that he would grant you , according to the riches of his glory , that ye may be strengthened with power through his spirit in the inward man ;
1	that christ may dwell in your hearts through faith ; to the end that ye , being rooted and grounded in love ,
1	may be strong to apprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth ,
1	and to know the love of christ which passeth knowledge , that ye may be filled unto all the fulness of god .
1	now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think , according to the power that worketh in us ,
1	unto him be the glory in the church and in christ jesus unto all generations for ever and ever . amen .
1	i therefore , the prisoner in the lord , beseech you to walk worthily of the calling wherewith ye were called ,
1	with all lowliness and meekness , with longsuffering , forbearing one another in love ;
1	giving diligence to keep the unity of the spirit in the bond of peace .
1	there is one body , and one spirit , even as also ye were called in one hope of your calling ;
1	one lord , one faith , one baptism ,
1	one god and father of all , who is over all , and through all , and in all .
1	but unto each one of us was the grace given according to the measure of the gift of christ .
1	( now this , he ascended , what is it but that he also descended into the lower parts of the earth ?
1	he that descended is the same also that ascended far above all the heavens , that he might fill all things . )
1	and he gave some to be apostles ; and some , prophets ; and some , evangelists ; and some , pastors and teachers ;
1	for the perfecting of the saints , unto the work of ministering , unto the building up of the body of christ :
1	but speaking truth in love , may grow up in all things into him , who is the head , even christ ;
1	this i say therefore , and testify in the lord , that ye no longer walk as the gentiles also walk , in the vanity of their mind ,
1	being darkened in their understanding , alienated from the life of god , because of the ignorance that is in them , because of the hardening of their heart ;
1	who being past feeling gave themselves up to lasciviousness , to work all uncleanness with greediness .
1	but ye did not so learn christ ;
1	if so be that ye heard him , and were taught in him , even as truth is in jesus :
1	that ye put away , as concerning your former manner of life , the old man , that waxeth corrupt after the lusts of deceit ;
1	and that ye be renewed in the spirit of your mind ,
1	and put on the new man , that after god hath been created in righteousness and holiness of truth .
1	wherefore , putting away falsehood , speak ye truth each one with his neighbor : for we are members one of another .
1	be ye angry , and sin not : let not the sun go down upon your wrath :
1	neither give place to the devil .
1	and grieve not the holy spirit of god , in whom ye were sealed unto the day of redemption .
1	let all bitterness , and wrath , and anger , and clamor , and railing , be put away from you , with all malice :
1	and be ye kind one to another , tenderhearted , forgiving each other , even as god also in christ forgave you .
1	be ye therefore imitators of god , as beloved children ;
1	but fornication , and all uncleanness , or covetousness , let it not even be named among you , as becometh saints ;
1	nor filthiness , nor foolish talking , or jesting , which are not befitting : but rather giving of thanks .
1	let no man deceive you with empty words : for because of these things cometh the wrath of god upon the sons of disobedience .
1	be not ye therefore partakers with them ;
1	for ye were once darkness , but are now light in the lord : walk as children of light
1	( for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth ) ,
1	proving what is well-pleasing unto the lord ;
1	and have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness , but rather even reprove them ;
1	for the things which are done by them in secret it is a shame even to speak of .
1	but all things when they are reproved are made manifest by the light : for everything that is made manifest is light .
1	wherefore he saith , awake , thou that sleepest , and arise from the dead , and christ shall shine upon thee .
1	look therefore carefully how ye walk , not as unwise , but as wise ;
1	redeeming the time , because the days are evil .
1	wherefore be ye not foolish , but understand what the will of the lord is .
1	and be not drunken with wine , wherein is riot , but be filled with the spirit ;
1	speaking one to another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs , singing and making melody with your heart to the lord ;
1	giving thanks always for all things in the name of our lord jesus christ to god , even the father ;
1	subjecting yourselves one to another in the fear of christ .
1	wives , be in subjection unto your own husbands , as unto the lord .
1	for the husband is the head of the wife , as christ also is the head of the church , being himself the saviour of the body .
1	but as the church is subject to christ , so let the wives also be to their husbands in everything .
1	husbands , love your wives , even as christ also loved the church , and gave himself up for it ;
1	that he might sanctify it , having cleansed it by the washing of water with the word ,
1	even so ought husbands also to love their own wives as their own bodies . he that loveth his own wife loveth himself :
1	for no man ever hated his own flesh ; but nourisheth and cherisheth it , even as christ also the church ;
1	because we are members of his body .
1	for this cause shall a man leave his father and mother , and shall cleave to his wife ; and the two shall become one flesh .
1	this mystery is great : but i speak in regard of christ and of the church .
1	nevertheless do ye also severally love each one his own wife even as himself ; and let the wife see that she fear her husband .
1	children , obey your parents in the lord : for this is right .
1	honor thy father and mother ( which is the first commandment with promise ) ,
1	that it may be well with thee , and thou mayest live long on the earth .
1	and , ye fathers , provoke not your children to wrath : but nurture them in the chastening and admonition of the lord .
1	servants , be obedient unto them that according to the flesh are your masters , with fear and trembling , in singleness of your heart , as unto christ ;
1	not in the way of eyeservice , as men-pleasers ; but as servants of christ , doing the will of god from the heart ;
1	with good will doing service , as unto the lord , and not unto men :
1	knowing that whatsoever good thing each one doeth , the same shall he receive again from the lord , whether he be bond or free .
1	finally , be strong in the lord , and in the strength of his might .
1	put on the whole armor of god , that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil .
1	wherefore take up the whole armor of god , that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day , and , having done all , to stand .
1	stand therefore , having girded your loins with truth , and having put on the breastplate of righteousness ,
1	and having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace ;
1	withal taking up the shield of faith , wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the evil one .
1	and take the helmet of salvation , and the sword of the spirit , which is the word of god :
1	with all prayer and supplication praying at all seasons in the spirit , and watching thereunto in all perseverance and supplication for all the saints ,
1	and on my behalf , that utterance may be given unto me in opening my mouth , to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel ,
1	for which i am an ambassador in chains ; that in it i may speak boldly , as i ought to speak .
1	whom i have sent unto you for this very purpose , that ye may know our state , and that he may comfort your hearts .
1	peace be to the brethren , and love with faith , from god the father and the lord jesus christ .
1	grace be with all them that love our lord jesus christ with a love incorruptible .
1	that in those days , when the king ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom , which was in shushan the palace ,
1	when he showed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honor of his excellent majesty many days , even a hundred and fourscore days .
1	also vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal house which belonged to king ahasuerus .
1	then the king said to the wise men , who knew the times ( for so was the king ’ s manner toward all that knew law and judgment ;
1	what shall we do unto the queen vashti according to law , because she hath not done the bidding of the king ahasuerus by the chamberlains ?
1	and the saying pleased the king and the princes ; and the king did according to the word of memucan :
1	after these things , when the wrath of king ahasuerus was pacified , he remembered vashti , and what she had done , and what was decreed against her .
1	then said the king ’ s servants that ministered unto him , let there be fair young virgins sought for the king :
1	and let the maiden that pleaseth the king be queen instead of vashti . and the thing pleased the king ; and he did so .
1	esther had not made known her people nor her kindred ; for mordecai had charged her that she should not make it known .
1	and mordecai walked every day before the court of the women ’ s house , to know how esther did , and what would become of her .
1	so esther was taken unto king ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month , which is the month tebeth , in the seventh year of his reign .
1	and when the virgins were gathered together the second time , then mordecai was sitting in the king ’ s gate .
1	and the thing became known to mordecai , who showed it unto esther the queen ; and esther told the king thereof in mordecai ’ s name .
1	then the king ’ s servants , that were in the king ’ s gate , said unto mordecai , why transgressest thou the king ’ s commandment ?
1	and when haman saw that mordecai bowed not down , nor did him reverence , then was haman full of wrath .
1	and the king took his ring from his hand , and gave it unto haman the son of hammedatha the agagite , the jews ’ enemy .
1	and the king said unto haman , the silver is given to thee , the people also , to do with them as it seemeth good to thee .
1	and he came even before the king ’ s gate : for none might enter within the king ’ s gate clothed with sackcloth .
1	so hathach went forth to mordecai unto the broad place of the city , which was before the king ’ s gate .
1	and hathach came and told esther the words of mordecai .
1	then esther spake unto hathach , and gave him a message unto mordecai , saying :
1	and they told to mordecai esther ’ s words .
1	then mordecai bade them return answer unto esther , think not with thyself that thou shalt escape in the king ’ s house , more than all the jews .
1	then esther bade them return answer unto mordecai ,
1	so mordecai went his way , and did according to all that esther had commanded him .
1	and esther said , if it seem good unto the king , let the king and haman come this day unto the banquet that i have prepared for him .
1	then answered esther , and said , my petition and my request is :
1	nevertheless haman refrained himself , and went home ; and he sent and fetched his friends and zeresh his wife .
1	yet all this availeth me nothing , so long as i see mordecai the jew sitting at the king ’ s gate .
1	on that night could not the king sleep ; and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles , and they were read before the king .
1	and the king ’ s servants said unto him , behold , haman standeth in the court . and the king said , let him come in .
1	and haman said unto the king , for the man whom the king delighteth to honor ,
1	and mordecai came again to the king ’ s gate . but haman hasted to his house , mourning and having his head covered .
1	while they were yet talking with him , came the king ’ s chamberlains , and hasted to bring haman unto the banquet that esther had prepared .
1	so the king and haman came to banquet with esther the queen .
1	and esther said , an adversary and an enemy , even this wicked haman . then haman was afraid before the king and the queen .
1	so they hanged haman on the gallows that he had prepared for mordecai . then was the king ’ s wrath pacified .
1	then the king held out to esther the golden sceptre . so esther arose , and stood before the king .
1	for how can i endure to see the evil that shall come unto my people ? or how can i endure to see the destruction of my kindred ?
1	upon one day in all the provinces of king ahasuerus , namely , upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month , which is the month adar .
1	the jews had light and gladness , and joy and honor .
1	for mordecai was great in the king ’ s house , and his fame went forth throughout all the provinces ; for the man mordecai waxed greater and greater .
1	and in shushan the palace the jews slew and destroyed five hundred men .
1	and parshandatha , and dalphon , and aspatha ,
1	and poratha , and adalia , and aridatha ,
1	and parmashta , and arisai , and aridai , and vaizatha ,
1	the ten sons of haman the son of hammedatha , the jews ’ enemy , slew they ; but on the spoil they laid not their hand .
1	on that day the number of those that were slain in shushan the palace was brought before the king .
1	and the king commanded it so to be done : and a decree was given out in shushan ; and they hanged haman ’ s ten sons .
1	and mordecai wrote these things , and sent letters unto all the jews that were in all the provinces of the king ahasuerus , both nigh and far ,
1	to enjoin them that they should keep the fourteenth day of the month adar , and the fifteenth day of the same , yearly ,
1	and the jews undertook to do as they had begun , and as mordecai had written unto them ;
1	then esther the queen , the daughter of abihail , and mordecai the jew , wrote with all authority to confirm this second letter of purim .
1	and he sent letters unto all the jews , to the hundred twenty and seven provinces of the kingdom of ahasuerus , with words of peace and truth ,
1	and the commandment of esther confirmed these matters of purim ; and it was written in the book .
1	and the king ahasuerus laid a tribute upon the land , and upon the isles of the sea .
1	now these are the names of the sons of israel , who came into egypt ( every man and his household came with jacob ) :
1	reuben , simeon , levi , and judah ,
1	issachar , zebulun , and benjamin ,
1	dan and naphtali , gad and asher .
1	and all the souls that came out of the loins of jacob were seventy souls : and joseph was in egypt already .
1	and joseph died , and all his brethren , and all that generation .
1	and the children of israel were fruitful , and increased abundantly , and multiplied , and waxed exceeding mighty ; and the land was filled with them .
1	now there arose a new king over egypt , who knew not joseph .
1	and he said unto his people , behold , the people of the children of israel are more and mightier than we :
1	therefore they did set over them taskmasters to afflict them with their burdens . and they built for pharaoh store-cities , pithom and raamses .
1	but the more they afflicted them , the more they multiplied and the more they spread abroad . and they were grieved because of the children of israel .
1	and the egyptians made the children of israel to serve with rigor :
1	and the king of egypt spake to the hebrew midwives , of whom the name of the one was shiphrah , and the name of the other puah :
1	but the midwives feared god , and did not as the king of egypt commanded them , but saved the men-children alive .
1	and the king of egypt called for the midwives , and said unto them , why have ye done this thing , and have saved the men-children alive ?
1	and god dealt well with the midwives : and the people multiplied , and waxed very mighty .
1	and it came to pass , because the midwives feared god , that he made them households .
1	and pharaoh charged all his people , saying , every son that is born ye shall cast into the river , and every daughter ye shall save alive .
1	and there went a man of the house of levi , and took to wife a daughter of levi .
1	and the woman conceived , and bare a son : and when she saw him that he was a goodly child , she hid him three months .
1	and his sister stood afar off , to know what would be done to him .
1	and pharaoh ’ s daughter said to her , go . and the maiden went and called the child ’ s mother .
1	now the priest of midian had seven daughters : and they came and drew water , and filled the troughs to water their father ’ s flock .
1	and the shepherds came and drove them away ; but moses stood up and helped them , and watered their flock .
1	and when they came to reuel their father , he said , how is it that ye are come so soon to-day ?
1	and they said , an egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds , and moreover he drew water for us , and watered the flock .
1	and moses was content to dwell with the man : and he gave moses zipporah his daughter .
1	and she bare a son , and he called his name gershom ; for he said , i have been a sojourner in a foreign land .
1	and god heard their groaning , and god remembered his covenant with abraham , with isaac , and with jacob .
1	and god saw the children of israel , and god took knowledge of them .
1	and moses said , i will turn aside now , and see this great sight , why the bush is not burnt .
1	and he said , draw not nigh hither : put off thy shoes from off thy feet , for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground .
1	and now , behold , the cry of the children of israel is come unto me : moreover i have seen the oppression wherewith the egyptians oppress them .
1	come now therefore , and i will send thee unto pharaoh , that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of israel out of egypt .
1	and i know that the king of egypt will not give you leave to go , no , not by a mighty hand .
1	and jehovah said unto him , what is that in thy hand ? and he said , a rod .
1	now therefore go , and i will be with thy mouth , and teach thee what thou shalt speak .
1	and he said , oh , lord , send , i pray thee , by the hand of him whom thou wilt send .
1	and thou shalt take in thy hand this rod , wherewith thou shalt do the signs .
1	and jehovah said unto moses in midian , go , return into egypt ; for all the men are dead that sought thy life .
1	and thou shalt say unto pharaoh , thus saith jehovah , israel is my son , my first-born :
1	and it came to pass on the way at the lodging-place , that jehovah met him , and sought to kill him .
1	so he let him alone . then she said , a bridegroom of blood art thou , because of the circumcision .
1	and moses told aaron all the words of jehovah wherewith he had sent him , and all the signs wherewith he had charged him .
1	and moses and aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of israel :
1	and aaron spake all the words which jehovah had spoken unto moses , and did the signs in the sight of the people .
1	and the king of egypt said unto them , wherefore do ye , moses and aaron , loose the people from their works ? get you unto your burdens .
1	and pharaoh said , behold , the people of the land are now many , and ye make them rest from their burdens .
1	and the same day pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people , and their officers , saying ,
1	ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick , as heretofore : let them go and gather straw for themselves .
1	let heavier work be laid upon the men , that they may labor therein ; and let them not regard lying words .
1	go yourselves , get you straw where ye can find it ; for nought of your work shall be diminished .
1	so the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of egypt to gather stubble for straw .
1	and the taskmasters were urgent , saying , fulfil your works , your daily tasks , as when there was straw .
1	then the officers of the children of israel came and cried unto pharaoh , saying , wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants ?
1	but he said , ye are idle , ye are idle : therefore ye say , let us go and sacrifice to jehovah .
1	go therefore now , and work ; for there shall no straw be given you , yet shall ye deliver the number of bricks .
1	and they met moses and aaron , who stood in the way , as they came forth from pharaoh :
1	and moses returned unto jehovah , and said , lord , wherefore hast thou dealt ill with this people ? why is it that thou hast sent me ?
1	for since i came to pharaoh to speak in thy name , he hath dealt ill with this people ; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all .
1	and god spake unto moses , and said unto him , i am jehovah :
1	and i appeared unto abraham , unto isaac , and unto jacob , as god almighty ; but by my name jehovah i was not known to them .
1	and i have also established my covenant with them , to give them the land of canaan , the land of their sojournings , wherein they sojourned .
1	and moreover i have heard the groaning of the children of israel , whom the egyptians keep in bondage ; and i have remembered my covenant .
1	and moses spake so unto the children of israel : but they hearkened not unto moses for anguish of spirit , and for cruel bondage .
1	and jehovah spake unto moses , saying ,
1	go in , speak unto pharaoh king of egypt , that he let the children of israel go out of his land .

1	these are they that spake to pharaoh king of egypt , to bring out the children of israel from egypt : these are that moses and aaron .
1	and it came to pass on the day when jehovah spake unto moses in the land of egypt ,

1	and pharaoh turned and went into his house , neither did he lay even this to heart .

1	and seven days were fulfilled , after that jehovah had smitten the river .

1	and the magicians did in like manner with their enchantments , and brought up frogs upon the land of egypt .
1	and moses and aaron went out from pharaoh : and moses cried unto jehovah concerning the frogs which he had brought upon pharaoh .
1	and jehovah did according to the word of moses ; and the frogs died out of the houses , out of the courts , and out of the fields .
1	and they gathered them together in heaps ; and the land stank .
1	but when pharaoh saw that there was respite , he hardened his heart , and hearkened not unto them ; as jehovah had spoken .
1	and the magicians did so with their enchantments to bring forth lice , but they could not : and there were lice upon man , and upon beast .
1	and i will put a division between my people and thy people : by to-morrow shall this sign be .
1	and pharaoh called for moses and for aaron , and said , go ye , sacrifice to your god in the land .
1	we will go three days ’ journey into the wilderness , and sacrifice to jehovah our god , as he shall command us .
1	and moses went out from pharaoh , and entreated jehovah .
1	and pharaoh hardened his heart this time also , and he did not let the people go .
1	for if thou refuse to let them go , and wilt hold them still ,

1	and jehovah did that thing on the morrow ; and all the cattle of egypt died ; but of the cattle of the children of israel died not one .
1	and the magicians could not stand before moses because of the boils ; for the boils were upon the magicians , and upon all the egyptians .
1	and jehovah hardened the heart of pharaoh , and he hearkened not unto them ; as jehovah had spoken unto moses .
1	for now i had put forth my hand , and smitten thee and thy people with pestilence , and thou hadst been cut off from the earth :
1	as yet exaltest thou thyself against my people , that thou wilt not let them go ?
1	he that feared the word of jehovah among the servants of pharaoh made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses :
1	and he that regarded not the word of jehovah left his servants and his cattle in the field .

1	entreat jehovah ; for there hath been enough of these mighty thunderings and hail ; and i will let you go , and ye shall stay no longer .
1	but as for thee and thy servants , i know that ye will not yet fear jehovah god .

1	and ye shall let nothing of it remain until the morning ; but that which remaineth of it until the morning ye shall burn with fire .

1	all the congregation of israel shall keep it .

1	thou shalt not commit adultery .

1	thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor .
