1	and all the brethren that are with me , unto the churches of galatia :
1	grace to you and peace from god the father , and our lord jesus christ ,
1	who gave himself for our sins , that he might deliver us out of this present evil world , according to the will of our god and father :
1	to whom be the glory for ever and ever . amen .
1	i marvel that ye are so quickly removing from him that called you in the grace of christ unto a different gospel ;
1	which is not another gospel : only there are some that trouble you , and would pervert the gospel of christ .
1	but though we , or an angel from heaven , should preach unto you any gospel other than that which we preached unto you , let him be anathema .
1	for i make known to you , brethren , as touching the gospel which was preached by me , that it is not after man .
1	for neither did i receive it from man , nor was i taught it , but it came to me through revelation of jesus christ .
1	and i advanced in the jews ’ religion beyond many of mine own age among my countrymen , being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers .
1	but when it was the good pleasure of god , who separated me , even from my mother ’ s womb , and called me through his grace ,
1	to reveal his son in me , that i might preach him among the gentiles ; straightway i conferred not with flesh and blood :
1	neither went i up to jerusalem to them that were apostles before me : but i went away into arabia ; and again i returned unto damascus .
1	then after three years i went up to jerusalem to visit cephas , and tarried with him fifteen days .
1	but other of the apostles saw i none , save james the lord ’ s brother .
1	now touching the things which i write unto you , behold , before god , i lie not .
1	then i came into the regions of syria and cilicia .
1	and i was still unknown by face unto the churches of judaea which were in christ :
1	but they only heard say , he that once persecuted us now preacheth the faith of which he once made havoc ;
1	and they glorified god in me .
1	then after the space of fourteen years i went up again to jerusalem with barnabas , taking titus also with me .
1	but not even titus who was with me , being a greek , was compelled to be circumcised :
1	to whom we gave place in the way of subjection , no , not for an hour ; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you .
1	but contrariwise , when they saw that i had been intrusted with the gospel of the uncircumcision , even as peter with the gospel of the circumcision
1	( for he that wrought for peter unto the apostleship of the circumcision wrought for me also unto the gentiles ) ;
1	only they would that we should remember the poor ; which very thing i was also zealous to do .
1	but when cephas came to antioch , i resisted him to the face , because he stood condemned .
1	and the rest of the jews dissembled likewise with him ; insomuch that even barnabas was carried away with their dissimulation .
1	we being jews by nature , and not sinners of the gentiles ,
1	but if , while we sought to be justified in christ , we ourselves also were found sinners , is christ a minister of sin ? god forbid .
1	for if i build up again those things which i destroyed , i prove myself a transgressor .
1	for i through the law died unto the law , that i might live unto god .
1	i do not make void the grace of god : for if righteousness is through the law , then christ died for nought .
1	o foolish galatians , who did bewitch you , before whose eyes jesus christ was openly set forth crucified ?
1	this only would i learn from you , received ye the spirit by the works of the law , or by the hearing of faith ?
1	are ye so foolish ? having begun in the spirit , are ye now perfected in the flesh ?
1	did ye suffer so many things in vain ? if it be indeed in vain .
1	even as abraham believed god , and it was reckoned unto him for righteousness .
1	know therefore that they that are of faith , the same are sons of abraham .
1	so then they that are of faith are blessed with the faithful abraham .
1	now that no man is justified by the law before god , is evident : for , the righteous shall live by faith ;
1	and the law is not of faith ; but , he that doeth them shall live in them .
1	that upon the gentiles might come the blessing of abraham in christ jesus ; that we might receive the promise of the spirit through faith .
1	for if the inheritance is of the law , it is no more of promise : but god hath granted it to abraham by promise .
1	now a mediator is not a mediator of one ; but god is one .
1	but the scripture shut up all things under sin , that the promise by faith in jesus christ might be given to them that believe .
1	but before faith came , we were kept in ward under the law , shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed .
1	so that the law is become our tutor to bring us unto christ , that we might be justified by faith .
1	but now that faith is come , we are no longer under a tutor .
1	for ye are all sons of god , through faith , in christ jesus .
1	for as many of you as were baptized into christ did put on christ .
1	and if ye are christ ’ s , then are ye abraham ’ s seed , heirs according to promise .
1	but i say that so long as the heir is a child , he differeth nothing from a bondservant though he is lord of all ;
1	but is under guardians and stewards until the day appointed of the father .
1	so we also , when we were children , were held in bondage under the rudiments of the world :
1	but when the fulness of the time came , god sent forth his son , born of a woman , born under the law ,
1	that he might redeem them that were under the law , that we might receive the adoption of sons .
1	and because ye are sons , god sent forth the spirit of his son into our hearts , crying , abba , father .
1	so that thou art no longer a bondservant , but a son ; and if a son , then an heir through god .
1	howbeit at that time , not knowing god , ye were in bondage to them that by nature are no gods :
1	ye observe days , and months , and seasons , and years .
1	i am afraid of you , lest by any means i have bestowed labor upon you in vain .
1	i beseech you , brethren , become as i am , for i also am become as ye are . ye did me no wrong :
1	but ye know that because of an infirmity of the flesh i preached the gospel unto you the first time :
1	so then am i become your enemy , by telling you the truth ?
1	they zealously seek you in no good way ; nay , they desire to shut you out , that ye may seek them .
1	but it is good to be zealously sought in a good matter at all times , and not only when i am present with you .
1	my little children , of whom i am again in travail until christ be formed in you—
1	but i could wish to be present with you now , and to change my tone ; for i am perplexed about you .
1	tell me , ye that desire to be under the law , do ye not hear the law ?
1	for it is written , that abraham had two sons , one by the handmaid , and one by the freewoman .
1	howbeit the son by the handmaid is born after the flesh ; but the son by the freewoman is born through promise .
1	which things contain an allegory : for these women are two covenants ; one from mount sinai , bearing children unto bondage , which is hagar .
1	now this hagar is mount sinai in arabia and answereth to the jerusalem that now is : for she is in bondage with her children .
1	but the jerusalem that is above is free , which is our mother .
1	for it is written ,
1	now we , brethren , as isaac was , are children of promise .
1	but as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the spirit , so also it is now .
1	howbeit what saith the scripture ? cast out the handmaid and her son : for the son of the handmaid shall not inherit with the son of the freewoman .
1	wherefore , brethren , we are not children of a handmaid , but of the freewoman .
1	for freedom did christ set us free : stand fast therefore , and be not entangled again in a yoke of bondage .
1	behold , i paul say unto you , that , if ye receive circumcision , christ will profit you nothing .
1	yea , i testify again to every man that receiveth circumcision , that he is a debtor to do the whole law .
1	ye are severed from christ , ye who would be justified by the law ; ye are fallen away from grace .
1	for we through the spirit by faith wait for the hope of righteousness .
1	for in christ jesus neither circumcision availeth anything , nor uncircumcision ; but faith working through love .
1	ye were running well ; who hindered you that ye should not obey the truth ?
1	this persuasion came not of him that calleth you .
1	a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump .
1	but i , brethren , if i still preach circumcision , why am i still persecuted ? then hath the stumbling-block of the cross been done away .
1	i would that they that unsettle you would even go beyond circumcision .
1	for the whole law is fulfilled in one word , even in this : thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself .
1	but if ye bite and devour one another , take heed that ye be not consumed one of another .
1	but i say , walk by the spirit , and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh .
1	but if ye are led by the spirit , ye are not under the law .
1	now the works of the flesh are manifest , which are these : fornication , uncleanness , lasciviousness ,
1	idolatry , sorcery , enmities , strife , jealousies , wraths , factions , divisions , parties ,
1	but the fruit of the spirit is love , joy , peace , longsuffering , kindness , goodness , faithfulness ,
1	meekness , self-control ; against such there is no law .
1	and they that are of christ jesus have crucified the flesh with the passions and the lusts thereof .
1	if we live by the spirit , by the spirit let us also walk .
1	let us not become vainglorious , provoking one another , envying one another .
1	bear ye one another ’ s burdens , and so fulfil the law of christ .
1	for if a man thinketh himself to be something when he is nothing , he deceiveth himself .
1	but let each man prove his own work , and then shall he have his glorying in regard of himself alone , and not of his neighbor .
1	for each man shall bear his own burden .
1	but let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things .
1	be not deceived ; god is not mocked : for whatsoever a man soweth , that shall he also reap .
1	for he that soweth unto his own flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption ; but he that soweth unto the spirit shall of the spirit reap eternal life .
1	and let us not be weary in well-doing : for in due season we shall reap , if we faint not .
1	see with how large letters i write unto you with mine own hand .
1	for not even they who receive circumcision do themselves keep the law ; but they desire to have you circumcised , that they may glory in your flesh .
1	for neither is circumcision anything , nor uncircumcision , but a new creature .
1	and as many as shall walk by this rule , peace be upon them , and mercy , and upon the israel of god .
1	henceforth let no man trouble me ; for i bear branded on my body the marks of jesus .
1	the grace of our lord jesus christ be with your spirit , brethren . amen .
1	in the beginning god created the heavens and the earth .
1	and god said , let there be light : and there was light .
1	and god saw the light , that it was good : and god divided the light from the darkness .
1	and god called the light day , and the darkness he called night . and there was evening and there was morning , one day .
1	and god said , let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters , and let it divide the waters from the waters .
1	and god made the firmament , and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament : and it was so .
1	and god called the firmament heaven . and there was evening and there was morning , a second day .
1	and god said , let the waters under the heavens be gathered together unto one place , and let the dry land appear : and it was so .
1	and god called the dry land earth ; and the gathering together of the waters called he seas : and god saw that it was good .
1	and there was evening and there was morning , a third day .
1	and let them be for lights in the firmament of heaven to give light upon the earth : and it was so .
1	and god set them in the firmament of heaven to give light upon the earth ,
1	and to rule over the day and over the night , and to divide the light from the darkness : and god saw that it was good .
1	and there was evening and there was morning , a fourth day .
1	and god said , let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures , and let birds fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven .
1	and god blessed them , saying , be fruitful , and multiply , and fill the waters in the seas , and let birds multiply on the earth .
1	and there was evening and there was morning , a fifth day .
1	and god created man in his own image , in the image of god created he him ; male and female created he them .
1	and the heavens and the earth were finished , and all the host of them .
1	and on the seventh day god finished his work which he had made ; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made .
1	and god blessed the seventh day , and hallowed it ; because that in it he rested from all his work which god had created and made .
1	these are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created , in the day that jehovah god made earth and heaven .
1	but there went up a mist from the earth , and watered the whole face of the ground .
1	and jehovah god formed man of the dust of the ground , and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life ; and man became a living soul .
1	and jehovah god planted a garden eastward , in eden ; and there he put the man whom he had formed .
1	and a river went out of eden to water the garden ; and from thence it was parted , and became four heads .
1	the name of the first is pishon : that is it which compasseth the whole land of havilah , where there is gold ;
1	and the gold of that land is good : there is bdellium and the onyx stone .
1	and the name of the second river is gihon : the same is it that compasseth the whole land of cush .
1	and the name of the third river is hiddekel : that is it which goeth in front of assyria . and the fourth river is the euphrates .
1	and jehovah god took the man , and put him into the garden of eden to dress it and to keep it .
1	and jehovah god commanded the man , saying , of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat :
1	and jehovah god said , it is not good that the man should be alone ; i will make him a help meet for him .
1	and the rib , which jehovah god had taken from the man , made he a woman , and brought her unto the man .
1	therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother , and shall cleave unto his wife : and they shall be one flesh .
1	and they were both naked , the man and his wife , and were not ashamed .
1	and the woman said unto the serpent , of the fruit of the trees of the garden we may eat :
1	and the serpent said unto the woman , ye shall not surely die :
1	and the eyes of them both were opened , and they knew that they were naked ; and they sewed fig-leaves together , and made themselves aprons .
1	and jehovah god called unto the man , and said unto him , where art thou ?
1	and he said , i heard thy voice in the garden , and i was afraid , because i was naked ; and i hid myself .
1	and he said , who told thee that thou wast naked ? hast thou eaten of the tree , whereof i commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat ?
1	and the man said , the woman whom thou gavest to be with me , she gave me of the tree , and i did eat .
1	and jehovah god said unto the woman , what is this thou hast done ? and the woman said , the serpent beguiled me , and i did eat .
1	thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee ; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field ;
1	and the man called his wife ’ s name eve ; because she was the mother of all living .
1	and jehovah god made for adam and for his wife coats of skins , and clothed them .
1	therefore jehovah god sent him forth from the garden of eden , to till the ground from whence he was taken .
1	and the man knew eve his wife ; and she conceived , and bare cain , and said , i have gotten a man with the help of jehovah .
1	and again she bare his brother abel . and abel was a keeper of sheep , but cain was a tiller of the ground .
1	and in process of time it came to pass , that cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto jehovah .
1	and abel , he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof . and jehovah had respect unto abel and to his offering :
1	but unto cain and to his offering he had not respect . and cain was very wroth , and his countenance fell .
1	and jehovah said unto cain , why art thou wroth ? and why is thy countenance fallen ?
1	and jehovah said unto cain , where is abel thy brother ? and he said , i know not : am i my brother ’ s keeper ?
1	and he said , what hast thou done ? the voice of thy brother ’ s blood crieth unto me from the ground .
1	and now cursed art thou from the ground , which hath opened its mouth to receive thy brother ’ s blood from thy hand ;
1	when thou tillest the ground , it shall not henceforth yield unto thee its strength ; a fugitive and a wanderer shalt thou be in the earth .
1	and cain said unto jehovah , my punishment is greater than i can bear .
1	and cain went out from the presence of jehovah , and dwelt in the land of nod , on the east of eden .
1	and unto enoch was born irad : and irad begat mehujael ; and mehujael begat methushael ; and methushael begat lamech .
1	and lamech took unto him two wives : the name of the one was adah , and the name of the other zillah .
1	and adah bare jabal : he was the father of such as dwell in tents and have cattle .
1	and his brother ’ s name was jubal : he was the father of all such as handle the harp and pipe .
1	and zillah , she also bare tubal-cain , the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron : and the sister of tubal-cain was naamah .
1	and lamech said unto his wives :
1	if cain shall be avenged sevenfold ,
1	this is the book of the generations of adam . in the day that god created man , in the likeness of god made he him ;
1	male and female created he them , and blessed them , and called their name adam , in the day when they were created .
1	and adam lived a hundred and thirty years , and begat a son in his own likeness , after his image ; and called his name seth :
1	and the days of adam after he begat seth were eight hundred years : and he begat sons and daughters .
1	and all the days that adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years : and he died .
1	and seth lived a hundred and five years , and begat enosh :
1	and seth lived after he begat enosh eight hundred and seven years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of seth were nine hundred and twelve years : and he died .
1	and enosh lived ninety years , and begat kenan .
1	and enosh lived after he begat kenan eight hundred and fifteen years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of enosh were nine hundred and five years : and he died .
1	and kenan lived seventy years , and begat mahalalel :
1	and kenan lived after he begat mahalalel eight hundred and forty years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of kenan were nine hundred and ten years : and he died .
1	and mahalalel lived sixty and five years , and begat jared :
1	and mahalalel lived after he begat jared eight hundred and thirty years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of mahalalel were eight hundred ninety and five years : and he died .
1	and jared lived a hundred sixty and two years , and begat enoch :
1	and jared lived after he begat enoch eight hundred years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of jared were nine hundred sixty and two years : and he died .
1	and enoch lived sixty and five years , and begat methuselah :
1	and enoch walked with god after he begat methuselah three hundred years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of enoch were three hundred sixty and five years :
1	and enoch walked with god : and he was not ; for god took him .
1	and methuselah lived a hundred eighty and seven years , and begat lamech :
1	and methuselah lived after he begat lamech seven hundred eighty and two years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years : and he died .
1	and lamech lived a hundred eighty and two years , and begat a son :
1	and lamech lived after he begat noah five hundred ninety and five years , and begat sons and daughters :
1	and all the days of lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years : and he died .
1	and noah was five hundred years old : and noah begat shem , ham , and japheth .
1	and it came to pass , when men began to multiply on the face of the ground , and daughters were born unto them ,
1	that the sons of god saw the daughters of men that they were fair ; and they took them wives of all that they chose .
1	and jehovah saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth , and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually .
1	and it repented jehovah that he had made man on the earth , and it grieved him at his heart .
1	but noah found favor in the eyes of jehovah .
1	these are the generations of noah . noah was a righteous man , and perfect in his generations : noah walked with god .
1	and noah begat three sons , shem , ham , and japheth .
1	and the earth was corrupt before god , and the earth was filled with violence .
1	and god saw the earth , and , behold , it was corrupt ; for all flesh had corrupted their way upon the earth .
1	make thee an ark of gopher wood ; rooms shalt thou make in the ark , and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch .
1	thus did noah ; according to all that god commanded him , so did he .
1	and jehovah said unto noah , come thou and all thy house into the ark ; for thee have i seen righteous before me in this generation .
1	of the birds also of the heavens , seven and seven , male and female , to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth .
1	and noah did according unto all that jehovah commanded him .
1	and noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth .
1	of clean beasts , and of beasts that are not clean , and of birds , and of everything that creepeth upon the ground ,
1	there went in two and two unto noah into the ark , male and female , as god commanded noah .
1	and it came to pass after the seven days , that the waters of the flood were upon the earth .
1	and the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights .
1	and they went in unto noah into the ark , two and two of all flesh wherein is the breath of life .
1	and they that went in , went in male and female of all flesh , as god commanded him : and jehovah shut him in .
1	and the flood was forty days upon the earth ; and the waters increased , and bare up the ark , and it was lifted up above the earth .
1	and the waters prevailed , and increased greatly upon the earth ; and the ark went upon the face of the waters .
1	and the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth ; and all the high mountains that were under the whole heaven were covered .
1	fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail ; and the mountains were covered .
1	all in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life , of all that was on the dry land , died .
1	and the waters prevailed upon the earth a hundred and fifty days .
1	the fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped , and the rain from heaven was restrained ;
1	and the waters returned from off the earth continually : and after the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters decreased .
1	and the ark rested in the seventh month , on the seventeenth day of the month , upon the mountains of ararat .
1	and it came to pass at the end of forty days , that noah opened the window of the ark which he had made :
1	and he sent forth a raven , and it went forth to and fro , until the waters were dried up from off the earth .
1	and he sent forth a dove from him , to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground ;
1	and he stayed yet other seven days ; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark ;
1	and he stayed yet other seven days , and sent forth the dove ; and she returned not again unto him any more .
1	and in the second month , on the seven and twentieth day of the month , was the earth dry .
1	and god spake unto noah , saying ,
1	go forth from the ark , thou , and thy wife , and thy sons , and thy sons ’ wives with thee .
1	and noah went forth , and his sons , and his wife , and his sons ’ wives with him :
1	every beast , every creeping thing , and every bird , whatsoever moveth upon the earth , after their families , went forth out of the ark .
1	and noah builded an altar unto jehovah , and took of every clean beast , and of every clean bird , and offered burnt-offerings on the altar .
1	while the earth remaineth , seedtime and harvest , and cold and heat , and summer and winter , and day and night shall not cease .
1	and god blessed noah and his sons , and said unto them , be fruitful , and multiply , and replenish the earth .
1	every moving thing that liveth shall be food for you ; as the green herb have i given you all .
1	but flesh with the life thereof , which is the blood thereof , shall ye not eat .
1	whoso sheddeth man ’ s blood , by man shall his blood be shed : for in the image of god made he man .
1	and you , be ye fruitful , and multiply ; bring forth abundantly in the earth , and multiply therein .
1	and god spake unto noah , and to his sons with him , saying ,
1	and i , behold , i establish my covenant with you , and with your seed after you ;
1	i do set my bow in the cloud , and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth .
1	and it shall come to pass , when i bring a cloud over the earth , that the bow shall be seen in the cloud ,
1	and god said unto noah , this is the token of the covenant which i have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth .
1	and the sons of noah , that went forth from the ark , were shem , and ham , and japheth : and ham is the father of canaan .
1	these three were the sons of noah : and of these was the whole earth overspread .
1	and noah began to be a husbandman , and planted a vineyard :
1	and he drank of the wine , and was drunken ; and he was uncovered within his tent .
1	and ham , the father of canaan , saw the nakedness of his father , and told his two brethren without .
1	and noah awoke from his wine , and knew what his youngest son had done unto him .
1	and noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years .
1	and all the days of noah were nine hundred and fifty years : and he died .
1	the sons of japheth : gomer , and magog , and madai , and javan , and tubal , and meshech , and tiras .

1	and the sons of javan : elishah , and tarshish , kittim , and dodanim .

1	and the sons of ham : cush , and mizraim , and put , and canaan .
1	and cush begat nimrod : he began to be a mighty one in the earth .
1	he was a mighty hunter before jehovah : wherefore it is said , like nimrod a mighty hunter before jehovah .
1	and the beginning of his kingdom was babel , and erech , and accad , and calneh , in the land of shinar .
1	out of that land he went forth into assyria , and builded nineveh , and rehoboth-ir , and calah ,
1	and resen between nineveh and calah ( the same is the great city ) .
1	and mizraim begat ludim , and anamim , and lehabim , and naphtuhim ,
1	and pathrusim , and casluhim ( whence went forth the philistines ) , and caphtorim .

1	and unto shem , the father of all the children of eber , the elder brother of japheth , to him also were children born .

1	and abram journeyed , going on still toward the south .

1	and it came to pass , that , when abram was come into egypt , the egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair .
1	and the princes of pharaoh saw her , and praised her to pharaoh : and the woman was taken into pharaoh ’ s house .
1	and jehovah plagued pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of sarai , abram ’ s wife .

1	and lot also , who went with abram , had flocks , and herds , and tents .
1	and the land was not able to bear them , that they might dwell together : for their substance was great , so that they could not dwell together .
1	so lot chose him all the plain of the jordan ; and lot journeyed east : and they separated themselves the one from the other .
1	abram dwelt in the land of canaan , and lot dwelt in the cities of the plain , and moved his tent as far as sodom .
1	now the men of sodom were wicked and sinners against jehovah exceedingly .

1	and it came to pass in the days of amraphel king of shinar , arioch king of ellasar , chedorlaomer king of elam , and tidal king of goiim ,
1	all these joined together in the vale of siddim ( the same is the salt sea ) .
1	twelve years they served chedorlaomer , and in the thirteenth year they rebelled .
1	and the horites in their mount seir , unto el-paran , which is by the wilderness .
1	against chedorlaomer king of elam , and tidal king of goiim , and amraphel king of shinar , and arioch king of ellasar ; four kings against the five .
1	and they took all the goods of sodom and gomorrah , and all their victuals , and went their way .
1	and they took lot , abram ’ s brother ’ s son , who dwelt in sodom , and his goods , and departed .
1	and he brought back all the goods , and also brought back his brother lot , and his goods , and the women also , and the people .
1	and melchizedek king of salem brought forth bread and wine : and he was priest of god most high .
1	and he blessed him , and said , blessed be abram of god most high , possessor of heaven and earth :
1	and blessed be god most high , who hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand . and he gave him a tenth of all .
1	and the king of sodom said unto abram , give me the persons , and take the goods to thyself .
1	and abram said to the king of sodom , i have lifted up my hand unto jehovah , god most high , possessor of heaven and earth ,
1	that i will not take a thread nor a shoe-latchet nor aught that is thine , lest thou shouldest say , i have made abram rich :
1	and abram said , behold , to me thou hast given no seed : and , lo , one born in my house is mine heir .
1	and he believed in jehovah ; and he reckoned it to him for righteousness .
1	and he said unto him , i am jehovah that brought thee out of ur of the chaldees , to give thee this land to inherit it .
1	and he said , o lord jehovah , whereby shall i know that i shall inherit it ?
1	and he took him all these , and divided them in the midst , and laid each half over against the other : but the birds divided he not .
1	and the birds of prey came down upon the carcasses , and abram drove them away .
1	and when the sun was going down , a deep sleep fell upon abram ; and , lo , a horror of great darkness fell upon him .
1	and also that nation , whom they shall serve , will i judge : and afterward shall they come out with great substance .
1	but thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace ; thou shalt be buried in a good old age .
1	and in the fourth generation they shall come hither again : for the iniquity of the amorite is not yet full .
1	the kenite , and the kenizzite , and the kadmonite ,

1	and your father hath deceived me , and changed my wages ten times ; but god suffered him not to hurt me .
1	thus god hath taken away the cattle of your father , and given them to me .
1	and the angel of god said unto me in the dream , jacob : and i said , here am i .
1	and rachel and leah answered and said unto him , is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father ’ s house ?
1	are we not accounted by him as foreigners ? for he hath sold us , and hath also quite devoured our money .
1	then jacob rose up , and set his sons and his wives upon the camels ;
1	now laban was gone to shear his sheep : and rachel stole the teraphim that were her father ’ s .
1	and jacob stole away unawares to laban the syrian , in that he told him not that he fled .
1	so he fled with all that he had ; and he rose up , and passed over the river , and set his face toward the mountain of gilead .
1	and it was told laban on the third day that jacob was fled .
1	and he took his brethren with him , and pursued after him seven days ’ journey ; and he overtook him in the mountain of gilead .
1	and laban came up with jacob . now jacob had pitched his tent in the mountain : and laban with his brethren encamped in the mountain of gilead .
1	and didst not suffer me to kiss my sons and my daughters ? now hast thou done foolishly .
1	and now , though thou wouldest needs be gone , because thou sore longedst after thy father ’ s house , yet wherefore hast thou stolen my gods ?
1	and jacob answered and said to laban , because i was afraid : for i said , lest thou shouldest take thy daughters from me by force .
1	thus i was ; in the day the drought consumed me , and the frost by night ; and my sleep fled from mine eyes .
1	and now come , let us make a covenant , i and thou ; and let it be for a witness between me and thee .
1	and jacob took a stone , and set it up for a pillar .
1	and jacob said unto his brethren , gather stones ; and they took stones , and made a heap : and they did eat there by the heap .
1	and laban called it jegar-saha-dutha : but jacob called it galeed .
1	and laban said , this heap is witness between me and thee this day . therefore was the name of it called galeed :
1	and mizpah , for he said , jehovah watch between me and thee , when we are absent one from another .
1	and laban said to jacob , behold this heap , and behold the pillar , which i have set betwixt me and thee .
1	and jacob went on his way , and the angels of god met him .
1	and jacob said when he saw them , this is god ’ s host : and he called the name of that place mahanaim .
1	and jacob sent messengers before him to esau his brother unto the land of seir , the field of edom .
1	and he said , if esau come to the one company , and smite it , then the company which is left shall escape .
1	and thou saidst , i will surely do thee good , and make thy seed as the sand of the sea , which can not be numbered for multitude .
1	and he lodged there that night , and took of that which he had with him a present for esau his brother :
1	two hundred she-goats and twenty he-goats , two hundred ewes and twenty rams ,
1	thirty milch camels and their colts , forty cows and ten bulls , twenty she-asses and ten foals .
1	so the present passed over before him : and he himself lodged that night in the company .
1	and he took them , and sent them over the stream , and sent over that which he had .
1	and jacob was left alone ; and there wrestled a man with him until the breaking of the day .
1	and he said , let me go , for the day breaketh . and he said , i will not let thee go , except thou bless me .
1	and he said unto him , what is thy name ? and he said , jacob .
1	and he said , thy name shall be called no more jacob , but israel : for thou hast striven with god and with men , and hast prevailed .
1	and jacob called the name of the place peniel : for , said he , i have seen god face to face , and my life is preserved .
1	and the sun rose upon him as he passed over penuel , and he limped upon his thigh .
1	and he put the handmaids and their children foremost , and leah and her children after , and rachel and joseph hindermost .
1	and he himself passed over before them , and bowed himself to the ground seven times , until he came near to his brother .
1	and esau ran to meet him , and embraced him , and fell on his neck , and kissed him : and they wept .
1	then the handmaids came near , they and their children , and they bowed themselves .
1	and leah also and her children came near , and bowed themselves : and after came joseph near and rachel , and they bowed themselves .
1	and he said , what meanest thou by all this company which i met ? and he said , to find favor in the sight of my lord .
1	and esau said , i have enough , my brother ; let that which thou hast be thine .
1	and he said , let us take our journey , and let us go , and i will go before thee .
1	so esau returned that day on his way unto seir .
1	and jacob journeyed to succoth , and built him a house , and made booths for his cattle : therefore the name of the place is called succoth .
1	and he erected there an altar , and called it el-elohe-israel .
1	and dinah the daughter of leah , whom she bare unto jacob , went out to see the daughters of the land .
1	and his soul clave unto dinah the daughter of jacob , and he loved the damsel , and spake kindly unto the damsel .
1	and shechem spake unto his father hamor , saying , get me this damsel to wife .
1	and hamor the father of shechem went out unto jacob to commune with him .
1	and hamor communed with them , saying , the soul of my son shechem longeth for your daughter : i pray you , give her unto him to wife .
1	and make ye marriages with us ; give your daughters unto us , and take our daughters unto you .
1	and ye shall dwell with us : and the land shall be before you ; dwell and trade ye therein , and get you possessions therein .
1	and shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren , let me find favor in your eyes , and what ye shall say unto me i will give .
1	ask me never so much dowry and gift , and i will give according as ye shall say unto me : but give me the damsel to wife .
1	and the sons of jacob answered shechem and hamor his father with guile , and spake , because he had defiled dinah their sister ,
1	and said unto them , we can not do this thing , to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised ; for that were a reproach unto us .
1	only on this condition will we consent unto you : if ye will be as we are , that every male of you be circumcised ;
1	but if ye will not hearken unto us , to be circumcised ; then will we take our daughter , and we will be gone .
1	and their words pleased hamor , and shechem hamor ’ s son .
1	and hamor and shechem his son came unto the gate of their city , and communed with the men of their city , saying ,
1	shall not their cattle and their substance and all their beasts be ours ? only let us consent unto them , and they will dwell with us .
1	and they slew hamor and shechem his son with the edge of the sword , and took dinah out of shechem ’ s house , and went forth .
1	the sons of jacob came upon the slain , and plundered the city , because they had defiled their sister .
1	they took their flocks and their herds and their asses , and that which was in the city , and that which was in the field ;
1	and all their wealth , and all their little ones and their wives , took they captive and made a prey , even all that was in the house .
1	and they said , should he deal with our sister as with a harlot ?
1	and they journeyed : and a terror of god was upon the cities that were round about them , and they did not pursue after the sons of jacob .
1	so jacob came to luz , which is in the land of canaan ( the same is beth-el ) , he and all the people that were with him .
1	and deborah rebekah ’ s nurse died , and she was buried below beth-el under the oak : and the name of it was called allon-bacuth .
1	and god appeared unto jacob again , when he came from paddan-aram , and blessed him .
1	and the land which i gave unto abraham and isaac , to thee i will give it , and to thy seed after thee will i give the land .
1	and god went up from him in the place where he spake with him .
1	and jacob called the name of the place where god spake with him , beth-el .
1	and they journeyed from beth-el ; and there was still some distance to come to ephrath : and rachel travailed , and she had hard labor .
1	and rachel died , and was buried in the way to ephrath ( the same is beth-lehem ) .
1	and jacob set up a pillar upon her grave : the same is the pillar of rachel ’ s grave unto this day .
1	and israel journeyed , and spread his tent beyond the tower of eder .
1	the sons of leah : reuben , jacob ’ s first-born , and simeon , and levi , and judah , and issachar , and zebulun ;
1	the sons of rachel : joseph and benjamin ;
1	and the sons of bilhah , rachel ’ s handmaid : dan and naphtali ;
1	and the sons of zilpah , leah ’ s handmaid : gad and asher : these are the sons of jacob , that were born to him in paddan-aram .
1	and jacob came unto isaac his father to mamre , to kiriath-arba ( the same is hebron ) , where abraham and isaac sojourned .
1	and the days of isaac were a hundred and fourscore years .
1	now these are the generations of esau ( the same is edom ) .
1	and basemath ishmael ’ s daughter , sister of nebaioth .
1	and adah bare to esau eliphaz ; and basemath bare reuel ;
1	and oholibamah bare jeush , and jalam , and korah : these are the sons of esau , that were born unto him in the land of canaan .
1	for their substance was too great for them to dwell together ; and the land of their sojournings could not bear them because of their cattle .
1	and esau dwelt in mount seir : esau is edom .
1	and these are the generations of esau the father of the edomites in mount seir :
1	these are the names of esau ’ s sons : eliphaz the son of adah the wife of esau , reuel the son of basemath the wife of esau .
1	and the sons of eliphaz were teman , omar , zepho , and gatam , and kenaz .
1	and timna was concubine to eliphaz esau ’ s son ; and she bare to eliphaz amalek : these are the sons of adah , esau ’ s wife .
1	and these are the sons of reuel : nahath , and zerah , shammah , and mizzah : these were the sons of basemath , esau ’ s wife .
1	chief korah , chief gatam , chief amalek : these are the chiefs that came of eliphaz in the land of edom ; these are the sons of adah .
1	these are the sons of esau , and these are their chiefs : the same is edom .
1	these are the sons of seir the horite , the inhabitants of the land : lotan and shobal and zibeon and anah ,
1	and dishon and ezer and dishan : these are the chiefs that came of the horites , the children of seir in the land of edom .
1	and the children of lotan were hori and heman ; and lotan ’ s sister was timna .
1	and these are the children of shobal : alvan and manahath and ebal , shepho and onam .
1	and these are the children of anah : dishon and oholibamah the daughter of anah .
1	and these are the children of dishon : hemdan and eshban and ithran and cheran .
1	these are the children of ezer : bilhan and zaavan and akan .
1	these are the children of dishan : uz and aran .
1	these are the chiefs that came of the horites : chief lotan , chief shobal , chief zibeon , chief anah ,
1	chief dishon , chief ezer , chief dishan : these are the chiefs that came of the horites , according to their chiefs in the land of seir .
1	and these are the kings that reigned in the land of edom , before there reigned any king over the children of israel .
1	and bela the son of beor reigned in edom ; and the name of his city was dinhabah .
1	and bela died , and jobab the son of zerah of bozrah reigned in his stead .
1	and jobab died , and husham of the land of the temanites reigned in his stead .
1	and hadad died , and samlah of masrekah reigned in his stead .
1	and samlah died , and shaul of rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead .
1	and shaul died , and baal-hanan the son of achbor reigned in his stead .
1	chief oholibamah , chief elah , chief pinon ,
1	chief kenaz , chief teman , chief mibzar ,
1	and jacob dwelt in the land of his father ’ s sojournings , in the land of canaan .
1	now israel loved joseph more than all his children , because he was the son of his old age : and he made him a coat of many colors .
1	and his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren ; and they hated him , and could not speak peaceably unto him .
1	and joseph dreamed a dream , and he told it to his brethren : and they hated him yet the more .
1	and he said unto them , hear , i pray you , this dream which i have dreamed :
1	and his brethren envied him ; but his father kept the saying in mind .
1	and his brethren went to feed their father ’ s flock in shechem .
1	and a certain man found him , and , behold , he was wandering in the field : and the man asked him , saying , what seekest thou ?
1	and he said , i am seeking my brethren : tell me , i pray thee , where they are feeding the flock .
1	and they saw him afar off , and before he came near unto them , they conspired against him to slay him .
1	and they said one to another , behold , this dreamer cometh .
1	and reuben heard it , and delivered him out of their hand , and said , let us not take his life .
1	and they took him , and cast him into the pit : and the pit was empty , there was no water in it .
1	and judah said unto his brethren , what profit is it if we slay our brother and conceal his blood ?
1	and reuben returned unto the pit ; and , behold , joseph was not in the pit ; and he rent his clothes .
1	and he returned unto his brethren , and said , the child is not ; and i , whither shall i go ?
1	and they took joseph ’ s coat , and killed a he-goat , and dipped the coat in the blood ;
1	and jacob rent his garments , and put sackcloth upon his loins , and mourned for his son many days .
1	and the midianites sold him into egypt unto potiphar , an officer of pharaoh ’ s , the captain of the guard .
1	and it came to pass at that time , that judah went down from his brethren , and turned in to a certain adullamite , whose name was hirah .
1	and judah saw there a daughter of a certain canaanite whose name was shua ; and he took her , and went in unto her .
1	and she conceived , and bare a son ; and he called his name er .
1	and she conceived again , and bare a son ; and she called his name onan .
1	and she yet again bare a son , and called his name shelah : and he was at chezib , when she bare him .
1	and judah took a wife for er his first-born , and her name was tamar .
1	and er , judah ’ s first-born , was wicked in the sight of jehovah ; and jehovah slew him .
1	and the thing which he did was evil in the sight of jehovah : and he slew him also .
1	and it was told tamar , saying , behold , thy father-in-law goeth up to timnah to shear his sheep .
1	when judah saw her , he thought her to be a harlot ; for she had covered her face .
1	and she arose , and went away , and put off her veil from her , and put on the garments of her widowhood .
1	and it came to pass in the time of her travail , that , behold , twins were in her womb .
1	and afterward came out his brother , that had the scarlet thread upon his hand : and his name was called zerah .
1	and jehovah was with joseph , and he was a prosperous man ; and he was in the house of his master the egyptian .
1	and his master saw that jehovah was with him , and that jehovah made all that he did to prosper in his hand .
1	and it came to pass after these things , that his master ’ s wife cast her eyes upon joseph ; and she said , lie with me .
1	and it came to pass , when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand , and was fled forth ,
1	and she laid up his garment by her , until his master came home .
1	and it came to pass , as i lifted up my voice and cried , that he left his garment by me , and fled out .
1	but jehovah was with joseph , and showed kindness unto him , and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison .
1	and it came to pass after these things , that the butler of the king of egypt and his baker offended their lord the king of egypt .
1	and pharaoh was wroth against his two officers , against the chief of the butlers , and against the chief of the bakers .
1	and he put them in ward in the house of the captain of the guard , into the prison , the place where joseph was bound .
1	and the captain of the guard charged joseph with them , and he ministered unto them : and they continued a season in ward .
1	and joseph came in unto them in the morning , and saw them , and , behold , they were sad .
1	and he asked pharaoh ’ s officers that were with him in ward in his master ’ s house , saying , wherefore look ye so sad to-day ?
1	and the chief butler told his dream to joseph , and said to him , in my dream , behold , a vine was before me ;
1	and joseph said unto him , this is the interpretation of it : the three branches are three days ;
1	for indeed i was stolen away out of the land of the hebrews : and here also have i done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon .
1	and in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of baked food for pharaoh ; and the birds did eat them out of the basket upon my head .
1	and joseph answered and said , this is the interpretation thereof : the three baskets are three days ;
1	and he restored the chief butler unto his butlership again ; and he gave the cup into pharaoh ’ s hand :
1	but he hanged the chief baker : as joseph had interpreted to them .
1	yet did not the chief butler remember joseph , but forgat him .
1	and it came to pass at the end of two full years , that pharaoh dreamed : and , behold , he stood by the river .
1	and , behold , there came up out of the river seven kine , well-favored and fat-fleshed ; and they fed in the reed-grass .
1	and the ill-favored and lean-fleshed kine did eat up the seven well-favored and fat kine . so pharaoh awoke .
1	and he slept and dreamed a second time : and , behold , seven ears of grain came up upon one stalk , rank and good .
1	and , behold , seven ears , thin and blasted with the east wind , sprung up after them .
1	and the thin ears swallowed up the seven rank and full ears . and pharaoh awoke , and , behold , it was a dream .
1	then spake the chief butler unto pharaoh , saying , i do remember my faults this day :
1	pharaoh was wroth with his servants , and put me in ward in the house of the captain of the guard , me and the chief baker :
1	and we dreamed a dream in one night , i and he ; we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream .
1	and it came to pass , as he interpreted to us , so it was ; me he restored unto mine office , and him he hanged .
1	and joseph answered pharaoh , saying , it is not in me : god will give pharaoh an answer of peace .
1	and pharaoh spake unto joseph , in my dream , behold , i stood upon the brink of the river :
1	and , behold , there came up out of the river seven kine , fat-fleshed and well-favored ; and they fed in the reed-grass :
1	and the lean and ill-favored kine did eat up the first seven fat kine :
1	and i saw in my dream , and , behold , seven ears came up upon one stalk , full and good :
1	and , behold , seven ears , withered , thin , and blasted with the east wind , sprung up after them :
1	and the thin ears swallowed up the seven good ears : and i told it unto the magicians ; but there was none that could declare it to me .
1	and joseph said unto pharaoh , the dream of pharaoh is one : what god is about to do he hath declared unto pharaoh .
1	the seven good kine are seven years ; and the seven good ears are seven years : the dream is one .
1	that is the thing which i spake unto pharaoh : what god is about to do he hath showed unto pharaoh .
1	behold , there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of egypt :
1	and the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of that famine which followeth ; for it shall be very grievous .
1	and for that the dream was doubled unto pharaoh , it is because the thing is established by god , and god will shortly bring it to pass .
1	now therefore let pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise , and set him over the land of egypt .
1	and the thing was good in the eyes of pharaoh , and in the eyes of all his servants .
1	and pharaoh said unto his servants , can we find such a one as this , a man in whom the spirit of god is ?
1	and pharaoh said unto joseph , forasmuch as god hath showed thee all this , there is none so discreet and wise as thou :
1	thou shalt be over my house , and according unto thy word shall all my people be ruled : only in the throne will i be greater than thou .
1	and pharaoh said unto joseph , see , i have set thee over all the land of egypt .
1	and pharaoh said unto joseph , i am pharaoh , and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in all the land of egypt .
1	and in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfuls .
1	and joseph laid up grain as the sand of the sea , very much , until he left off numbering ; for it was without number .
1	and unto joseph were born two sons before the year of famine came , whom asenath , the daughter of potiphera priest of on , bare unto him .
1	and the name of the second called he ephraim : for god hath made me fruitful in the land of my affliction .
1	and the seven years of plenty , that was in the land of egypt , came to an end .
1	and all countries came into egypt to joseph to buy grain , because the famine was sore in all the earth .
1	now jacob saw that there was grain in egypt , and jacob said unto his sons , why do ye look one upon another ?
1	and joseph ’ s ten brethren went down to buy grain from egypt .
1	but benjamin , joseph ’ s brother , jacob sent not with his brethren ; for he said , lest peradventure harm befall him .
1	and the sons of israel came to buy among those that came : for the famine was in the land of canaan .
1	and joseph knew his brethren , but they knew not him .
1	and they said unto him , nay , my lord , but to buy food are thy servants come .
1	we are all one man ’ s sons ; we are true men , thy servants are no spies .
1	and he said unto them , nay , but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come .
1	and joseph said unto them , that is it that i spake unto you , saying , ye are spies :
1	hereby ye shall be proved : by the life of pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence , except your youngest brother come hither .
1	and he put them all together into ward three days .
1	and joseph said unto them the third day , this do , and live ; for i fear god :
1	if ye be true men , let one of your brethren be bound in your prison-house ; but go ye , carry grain for the famine of your houses :
1	and bring your youngest brother unto me ; so shall your words be verified , and ye shall not die . and they did so .
1	and they knew not that joseph understood them ; for there was an interpreter between them .
1	and they laded their asses with their grain , and departed thence .
1	and they came unto jacob their father unto the land of canaan , and told him all that had befallen them , saying ,
1	the man , the lord of the land , spake roughly with us , and took us for spies of the country .
1	and we said unto him , we are true men ; we are no spies :
1	we are twelve brethren , sons of our father ; one is not , and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of canaan .
1	and the famine was sore in the land .
1	if thou wilt send our brother with us , we will go down and buy thee food :
1	and israel said , wherefore dealt ye so ill with me , as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother ?
1	for except we had lingered , surely we had now returned a second time .
1	take also your brother , and arise , go again unto the man :
1	and the man did as joseph bade ; and the man brought the men to joseph ’ s house .
1	and they came near to the steward of joseph ’ s house , and they spake unto him at the door of the house ,
1	and said , oh , my lord , we came indeed down at the first time to buy food :
1	and other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food : we know not who put our money in our sacks .
1	and the man brought the men into joseph ’ s house , and gave them water , and they washed their feet ; and he gave their asses provender .
1	and they made ready the present against joseph ’ s coming at noon : for they heard that they should eat bread there .
1	and when joseph came home , they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house , and bowed down themselves to him to the earth .
1	and he asked them of their welfare , and said , is your father well , the old man of whom ye spake ? is he yet alive ?
1	and they said , thy servant our father is well , he is yet alive . and they bowed the head , and made obeisance .
1	and he washed his face , and came out ; and he refrained himself , and said , set on bread .
1	and they sat before him , the first-born according to his birthright , and the youngest according to his youth : and the men marvelled one with another .
1	as soon as the morning was light , the men were sent away , they and their asses .
1	is not this that in which my lord drinketh , and whereby he indeed divineth ? ye have done evil in so doing .
1	and he overtook them , and he spake unto them these words .
1	and they said unto him , wherefore speaketh my lord such words as these ? far be it from thy servants that they should do such a thing .
1	with whomsoever of thy servants it be found , let him die , and we also will be my lord ’ s bondmen .
1	then they hasted , and took down every man his sack to the ground , and opened every man his sack .
1	and he searched , and began at the eldest , and left off at the youngest : and the cup was found in benjamin ’ s sack .
1	then they rent their clothes , and laded every man his ass , and returned to the city .
1	and judah and his brethren came to joseph ’ s house ; and he was yet there : and they fell before him on the ground .
1	and joseph said unto them , what deed is this that ye have done ? know ye not that such a man as i can indeed divine ?
1	my lord asked his servants , saying , have ye a father , or a brother ?
1	and thou saidst unto thy servants , bring him down unto me , that i may set mine eyes upon him .
1	and we said unto my lord , the lad can not leave his father : for if he should leave his father , his father would die .
1	and thou saidst unto thy servants , except your youngest brother come down with you , ye shall see my face no more .
1	and it came to pass when we came up unto thy servant my father , we told him the words of my lord .
1	and our father said , go again , buy us a little food .
1	and thy servant my father said unto us , ye know that my wife bare me two sons :
1	and the one went out from me , and i said , surely he is torn in pieces ; and i have not seen him since :
1	and if ye take this one also from me , and harm befall him , ye will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to sheol .
1	for how shall i go up to my father , if the lad be not with me ? lest i see the evil that shall come on my father .
1	and he wept aloud : and the egyptians heard , and the house of pharaoh heard .
1	and now be not grieved , nor angry with yourselves , that ye sold me hither : for god did send me before you to preserve life .
1	for these two years hath the famine been in the land : and there are yet five years , in which there shall be neither plowing nor harvest .
1	and god sent me before you to preserve you a remnant in the earth , and to save you alive by a great deliverance .
1	and , behold , your eyes see , and the eyes of my brother benjamin , that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you .
1	and he fell upon his brother benjamin ’ s neck , and wept ; and benjamin wept upon his neck .
1	and he kissed all his brethren , and wept upon them : and after that his brethren talked with him .
1	and pharaoh said unto joseph , say unto thy brethren , this do ye : lade your beasts , and go , get you unto the land of canaan ;

1	and thus , having patiently endured , he obtained the promise .
1	for men swear by the greater : and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation .

1	now even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service , and its sanctuary , a sanctuary of this world .
1	for there was a tabernacle prepared , the first , wherein were the candlestick , and the table , and the showbread ; which is called the holy place .
1	and after the second veil , the tabernacle which is called the holy of holies ;
1	and above it cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy-seat ; of which things we can not now speak severally .

1	being only ( with meats and drinks and divers washings ) carnal ordinances , imposed until a time of reformation .

1	for where a testament is , there must of necessity be the death of him that made it .
1	for a testament is of force where there hath been death : for it doth never avail while he that made it liveth .
1	wherefore even the first covenant hath not been dedicated without blood .
1	saying , this is the blood of the covenant which god commanded to you-ward .
1	moreover the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry he sprinkled in like manner with the blood .
1	and according to the law , i may almost say , all things are cleansed with blood , and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission .
1	it was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these ; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these .
1	nor yet that he should offer himself often , as the high priest entereth into the holy place year by year with blood not his own ;
1	and inasmuch as it is appointed unto men once to die , and after this cometh judgment ;
1	else would they not have ceased to be offered ? because the worshippers , having been once cleansed , would have had no more consciousness of sins .
1	but in those sacrifices there is a remembrance made of sins year by year .
1	for it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins .
1	wherefore when he cometh into the world , he saith ,
1	in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hadst no pleasure :
1	then said i , lo , i am come ( in the roll of the book it is written of me )

1	by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of jesus christ once for all .
1	and every priest indeed standeth day by day ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices , the which can never take away sins :
1	but he , when he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever , sat down on the right hand of god ;
1	henceforth expecting till his enemies be made the footstool of his feet .
1	for by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified .
1	and the holy spirit also beareth witness to us ; for after he hath said ,
1	this is the covenant that i will make with them
1	and their sins and their iniquities will i remember no more .
1	now where remission of these is , there is no more offering for sin .
1	having therefore , brethren , boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of jesus ,

1	and having a great priest over the house of god ;
1	let us hold fast the confession of our hope that it waver not ; for he is faithful that promised :
1	and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and good works ;
1	for if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth , there remaineth no more a sacrifice for sins ,
1	but a certain fearful expectation of judgment , and a fierceness of fire which shall devour the adversaries .

1	it is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living god .
1	but call to remembrance the former days , in which , after ye were enlightened , ye endured a great conflict of sufferings ;
1	partly , being made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions ; and partly , becoming partakers with them that were so used .
1	cast not away therefore your boldness , which hath great recompense of reward .
1	for ye have need of patience , that , having done the will of god , ye may receive the promise .
1	for yet a very little while ,
1	but my righteous one shall live by faith :
1	but we are not of them that shrink back unto perdition ; but of them that have faith unto the saving of the soul .
1	now faith is assurance of things hoped for , a conviction of things not seen .
1	for therein the elders had witness borne to them .
1	for he looked for the city which hath the foundations , whose builder and maker is god .
1	by faith even sarah herself received power to conceive seed when she was past age , since she counted him faithful who had promised :
1	for they that say such things make it manifest that they are seeking after a country of their own .
1	and if indeed they had been mindful of that country from which they went out , they would have had opportunity to return .
1	by faith abraham , being tried , offered up isaac : yea , he that had gladly received the promises was offering up his only begotten son ;
1	even he to whom it was said , in isaac shall thy seed be called :
1	accounting that god is able to raise up , even from the dead ; from whence he did also in a figure receive him back .
1	by faith isaac blessed jacob and esau , even concerning things to come .
1	by faith jacob , when he was dying , blessed each of the sons of joseph ; and worshipped , leaning upon the top of his staff .
1	by faith joseph , when his end was nigh , made mention of the departure of the children of israel ; and gave commandment concerning his bones .
1	by faith moses , when he was grown up , refused to be called the son of pharaoh ’ s daughter ;
1	choosing rather to share ill treatment with the people of god , than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season ;
1	accounting the reproach of christ greater riches than the treasures of egypt : for he looked unto the recompense of reward .
1	by faith he forsook egypt , not fearing the wrath of the king : for he endured , as seeing him who is invisible .
1	by faith he kept the passover , and the sprinkling of the blood , that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them .
1	by faith they passed through the red sea as by dry land : which the egyptians assaying to do were swallowed up .
1	by faith the walls of jericho fell down , after they had been compassed about for seven days .
1	by faith rahab the harlot perished not with them that were disobedient , having received the spies with peace .
1	who through faith subdued kingdoms , wrought righteousness , obtained promises , stopped the mouths of lions ,
1	women received their dead by a resurrection : and others were tortured , not accepting their deliverance ; that they might obtain a better resurrection :
1	and others had trial of mockings and scourgings , yea , moreover of bonds and imprisonment :
1	( of whom the world was not worthy ) , wandering in deserts and mountains and caves , and the holes of the earth .
1	and these all , having had witness borne to them through their faith , received not the promise ,
1	god having provided some better thing concerning us , that apart from us they should not be made perfect .
1	for consider him that hath endured such gainsaying of sinners against himself , that ye wax not weary , fainting in your souls .
1	ye have not yet resisted unto blood , striving against sin :
1	and ye have forgotten the exhortation which reasoneth with you as with sons ,
1	for whom the lord loveth he chasteneth ,
1	it is for chastening that ye endure ; god dealeth with you as with sons ; for what son is there whom his father chasteneth not ?
1	but if ye are without chastening , whereof all have been made partakers , then are ye bastards , and not sons .
1	for they indeed for a few days chastened us as seemed good to them ; but he for our profit , that we may be partakers of his holiness .
1	wherefore lift up the hands that hang down , and the palsied knees ;
1	and make straight paths for your feet , that that which is lame be not turned out of the way , but rather be healed .
1	follow after peace with all men , and the sanctification without which no man shall see the lord :
1	lest there be any fornicator , or profane person , as esau , who for one mess of meat sold his own birthright .
1	for ye are not come unto a mount that might be touched , and that burned with fire , and unto blackness , and darkness , and tempest ,
1	and the sound of a trumpet , and the voice of words ; which voice they that heard entreated that no word more should be spoken unto them ;
1	for they could not endure that which was enjoined , if even a beast touch the mountain , it shall be stoned ;
1	and so fearful was the appearance , that moses said , i exceedingly fear and quake :
1	but ye are come unto mount zion , and unto the city of the living god , the heavenly jerusalem , and to innumerable hosts of angels ,
1	and to jesus the mediator of a new covenant , and to the blood of sprinkling that speaketh better than that of abel .
1	wherefore , receiving a kingdom that can not be shaken , let us have grace , whereby we may offer service well-pleasing to god with reverence and awe :
1	for our god is a consuming fire .
1	let love of the brethren continue .
1	forget not to show love unto strangers : for thereby some have entertained angels unawares .
1	remember them that are in bonds , as bound with them ; them that are ill-treated , as being yourselves also in the body .
1	let marriage be had in honor among all , and let the bed be undefiled : for fornicators and adulterers god will judge .
1	so that with good courage we say ,
1	jesus christ is the same yesterday and to-day , yea and for ever .
1	we have an altar , whereof they have no right to eat that serve the tabernacle .
1	for the bodies of those beasts whose blood is brought into the holy place by the high priest as an offering for sin , are burned without the camp .
1	wherefore jesus also , that he might sanctify the people through his own blood , suffered without the gate .
1	let us therefore go forth unto him without the camp , bearing his reproach .
1	for we have not here an abiding city , but we seek after the city which is to come .
1	through him then let us offer up a sacrifice of praise to god continually , that is , the fruit of lips which make confession to his name .
1	but to do good and to communicate forget not : for with such sacrifices god is well pleased .
1	pray for us : for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience , desiring to live honorably in all things .
1	and i exhort you the more exceedingly to do this , that i may be restored to you the sooner .
1	but i exhort you , brethren , bear with the word of exhortation : for i have written unto you in few words .
1	know ye that our brother timothy hath been set at liberty ; with whom , if he come shortly , i will see you .
1	salute all them that have the rule over you , and all the saints . they of italy salute you .
1	grace be with you all . amen .
1	so he went and took gomer the daughter of diblaim ; and she conceived , and bare him a son .
1	and it shall come to pass at that day , that i will break the bow of israel in the valley of jezreel .
1	now when she had weaned lo-ruhamah , she conceived , and bare a son .
1	and jehovah said , call his name lo-ammi ; for ye are not my people , and i will not be your god .
1	say ye unto your brethren , ammi ; and to your sisters , ruhamah .
1	yea , upon her children will i have no mercy ; for they are children of whoredom ;
1	therefore , behold , i will hedge up thy way with thorns , and i will build a wall against her , that she shall not find her paths .
1	and now will i uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers , and none shall deliver her out of my hand .
1	i will also cause all her mirth to cease , her feasts , her new moons , and her sabbaths , and all her solemn assemblies .
1	therefore , behold , i will allure her , and bring her into the wilderness , and speak comfortably unto her .
1	and it shall be at that day , saith jehovah , that thou shalt call me ishi , and shalt call me no more baali .
1	for i will take away the names of the baalim out of her mouth , and they shall no more be mentioned by their name .
1	i will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness ; and thou shalt know jehovah .
1	and it shall come to pass in that day , i will answer , saith jehovah , i will answer the heavens , and they shall answer the earth ;
1	and the earth shall answer the grain , and the new wine , and the oil ; and they shall answer jezreel .
1	so i bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver , and a homer of barley , and a half-homer of barley ;
1	for the children of israel shall abide many days without king , and without prince , and without sacrifice , and without pillar , and without ephod or teraphim :
1	there is nought but swearing and breaking faith , and killing , and stealing , and committing adultery ; they break out , and blood toucheth blood .
1	yet let no man strive , neither let any man reprove ; for thy people are as they that strive with the priest .

1	and the revolters are gone deep in making slaughter ; but i am a rebuker of them all .

1	their doings will not suffer them to turn unto their god ; for the spirit of whoredom is within them , and they know not jehovah .
1	and the pride of israel doth testify to his face : therefore israel and ephraim shall stumble in their iniquity ; judah also shall stumble with them .
1	they shall go with their flocks and with their herds to seek jehovah ; but they shall not find him : he hath withdrawn himself from them .

1	the princes of judah are like them that remove the landmark : i will pour out my wrath upon them like water .

1	therefore am i unto ephraim as a moth , and to the house of judah as rottenness .

1	also , o judah , there is a harvest appointed for thee , when i bring back the captivity of my people .

1	they are all hot as an oven , and devour their judges ; all their kings are fallen : there is none among them that calleth unto me .
1	ephraim , he mixeth himself among the peoples ; ephraim is a cake not turned .

1	and the pride of israel doth testify to his face : yet they have not returned unto jehovah their god , nor sought him , for all this .
